review_body: We were supposed to arrive on Monday March 16th, in view of the health situation in France we can not honor our trip, I sent 2 emails to the hotel without any response from them for a refund ! Lamentable and very disappointed, we won't come to this hotel next year for the postponement of our holidays in Japan.

this hotel needs renovation, the front door doesnt work going to the lobby. also from the train station to the hotel is very far now. because like what the previous comment said, it had construction. you have to go the long way now.hotel room is very dusty and it seemed like housekeeping not doing good jobnot recommended

dirrty and old .and far from shibuya crossing because of construction. the ongoing construction in that area will make you circle the place before reaching shibuya crossing. what once took only 10 mins , now takes 20 mins to get to shibuya crossing. mind you there is no elevator. so if you have luggage, poor you. thats what happened to me. the hotel also looks dusty. and the rooms are old and in dire need of renovations. management should change the bathroom, its too old. bed was with stain too

We usually stay in 5 start hotels but we stayed there over New Years eve as that's apparently where the action is. We were at Keto plaza fShinjuku or a week before this.Japan closes down on New Years eve and we had no where to eat dinner.The hotel staff had no recommendations even though they should at least have some options for us. They know this happens every year so why not prepare the customers for this before hand!?We ended up buying prepacked food in near by 24 hr supermarket but when we asked reception for some cutleries they refused. Japanese seem so nice on the surface but so inflexible and their lack of care/empathy is astounding. The hotel is tiny and I felt dirty in there.This is supposed to be a 4 start hotel!

Great location just next to the train station.Breakfast is good. Room is Japanese’s style, Meaning it’s very very small but clean and comfortable. No gym. Great WiFi. Free coffee and tea (from machine) at reception.

I was super-pleased with the friendliness and professionalism of the front desk staff. I had a problem (of my own making, not related to the room, hotel, etc) and they did a wonderful job of helping me fix it.Excellent access to all the fun of the Shibuya area and easy access to the rest of Tokyo from there.

Hotel is very close to shibuya train station and crossing! Very clean rooms and comfortable stay. Helpful staff. But they should speak at least a bit english because they direct you different locations where you don’t ask. We stayed 2 times during our Japan trip. In second stay we asked for late check out just for more 20 or 30 mins but they directly wanted to charge it. It was not nice the way we got answer. It could be nice gesture to help. Apart from that very good location and surrounded with restaurants shopping centers.

Pleasant stay, the Granbell hotel is extremely well located, few steps away from the Shibuya station and few minutes from Shibuya crossing. The staff is particularly friendly and helpful at any time of the day and night.

Do not stay here rooms are so tiny u could not believe it!!!!!!!!!Not enough room swing a mouse!!Asked for bigger room told extra £3600 for 2 week stay!!!Do not stay here check room size of any hotel u book!!!

Modern, clean hotel with all you'll need in a great central location. Perfect for eating and shopping. Only set back was we were given smoking rooms which smelt of tobacco. Make sure you check this when you book.

Good location in Shibuya. Somewhat hidden from the street, so hard to find. A bit worn out, small - but well furbished - rooms. Train noise when your room is located on the left side of the corridor. Staff not that helpful (for Japan) and little or no English - which surprised us for that location.

Great location. Be careful as the rooms are very small and the bar/rest areas are not particularly welcoming if the weather is bad. Breakfast is basic and they do not seem keen to replenish when fruit is gone. Location is great and there are loads of restaurants close by. I would recommend for an overnight. 5 nights was too long

We traveled to Japan for a Rugby World Cup game.We were late in booking hotels recommended by friends; there were no vacancies. We choose the Granbell solely based on information on the internet.We choose well. The hotel is located a couple of minutes walk from Shibuya station in a quieter street away from the Shibuya crossing and all the neon lights.Our room included a two seater couch which we prefer to sit on rather than the bed.A big tick is the shower, a walk in shower separate to the bath. The toilet was a separate room to the bathroom.We didn’t use any of the facilities the hotel offered. Next door to the hotel is a ramen restaurant (some nights a small queue)and on the other side a pizza restaurant. Up the hill first right there is a very busy teppanyaki restaurant.We wheeled our suitcases along the street from the station with ease having arrived from Narita airport. We caught the NEX train to Shibuya. You can buy a NEX ticket from a window on the way to the “Trains”.We also purchased a Suica card to use on the trains in Tokyo, Kyoto and Osaka from a vending machines. We put 2000 yen and topped up the card throughout the trip.

I booked the Granbell because the photos I saw of the hotel made the place look very modern, sleek and stylish. So I was quite disappointed when I saw my room after checking in. The official photos are a little misleading.The bathroom was very tired and worn. The bathroom windows had this hideous green tint. The TV looked maybe 10-15 years old (it could easily pass as a computer monitor). After briefly lying on the bed, the bedsheets started coming out. It revealed an old mattress underneath. The hallways and the general hotel design was...strange. A host of mismatched colours scatter the walls and floors. While the lifts are a basic white colour on all surfaces. Some parts of the hallways are flooded with light, while other parts are very dim which can make it hard to see where you’re going. It looks like they were trying to go for a sleek stylish look but executed the idea terribly.Speaking of terrible, the WiFi was awful. Extremely slow. I ended up using my pocket WiFi as it was much faster. I’m not sure why they decided on individual WiFi routers in each room with their own WiFi connection name and password. It probably causes a lot of interference. You can easily guess the WiFi password of other rooms if you really wanted to. They all follow the same structure. In the end, the only stand out feature of this hotel was its proximity to the Shibuya shopping district. The front and back doors are a bit tucked away and easy to miss. While my overall stay was comfortable, given the the price, I probably wouldn’t come back again.

I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. One of the main things is that the hotel does not allow early chekin. In July 2019, i stayed in Shinjuku Granbell, they also did not allowed early checkin.Location:The hotel is walking distance of 5 minutes to world famous scramble crossing, also the area hosts lots of restraunts, pubs and bars. The area is very happening. The vibes are great.The hotel is also 2-3 minutes walking to Shibuya JR station which connects to Airport as well. Room:The room was decent in size compared to thought of sizes of Tokyo hotels. The bed was comfortable, but after putting luggage, the space in room was crippled.The room connects to bathroom, with separate WC and a separate bathing area. The bathing area also boasts a bathing tub, which is sort of luxury of the space is a crunch. The view from the room window was a dead wall.Bathroom:The bathing water pressure was very high, it should be a little controlled as it can hurt someone. The open washbasin concept is very common in Tokyo hotels.Internet:The speed of internet was decent, though we were using our own wifi device.

Shibuya GRandbell hotel has a great location. Is very near Shibuya crossing, and, even more important, just 2 blocks away from the Hotel where the limousine bus from the airport stops!!! There are many bars and restaurants near the hotel, and also some of the most important places where to go shopping (Don Quijote, 109, Uniqlo, etc). IT' s also located in a quiet street. The rooms are small, but like everything in Tokyo! The crew is really kind and speak very good English! They have japanese and occidental breakfast. I absolutly recommend this hotel!

The hotel is located in the Shibuya district which is very convenient if you arrive in Narita Airport. Simply take the N’EX and the hotel is about a 5 minute walk from the train and subway station. It was a little bit tricky to find at first. The description on the hotel website didn’t really work for me. When you find the correct West exit at Shibuya station, make sure you have the JR office to your left. A little bit further to your left you’ll see a pedestrian bridge. Go up the stairs and descend the first set of stairs straight ahead. Do not turn right on the bridge and go down the stairs there. Walk straight ahead and turn right at the 24h restaurant (the building with the bid golden buddha). Walk up the slope for about 100 meters and the hotel is located on your left. The location was quiet. And I say this as a light sleeper who is very easily distribed by noise. The craziness of the Shibuya scramble is a good ten minute walk from the hotel, and none of that sound can be heard from the hotel. There are a bunch of subway lines passing throught Shibuya station which makes navigating the city very easy. The room was one of the smallest hotel rooms I’ve stayed in. People weren’t kidding when they said there was barely enough room for their suitcases. If all you’re looking for in a hotel room is a place to sleep then this is absolutely fine. But if you want a place where you can relax and just watch some TV or read, then this is not the hotel for you. There isn’t really enough room to sit comfortably. The bed, as just about always in Asia, was far too hard for my taste. I’ve said this in a bunch of reviews for other hotels, but for the life of me I can’t understand how people invest a lot of in hotels, buying continental beds but skimping on the top pillow mattress, which means that in essence you’re lying directly on top of the box spring mattress. If you don’t mind hard beds then this is absolutely fine. But if you, like me, beds a bit softer or more comfortable, then this is probably not the hotel for you. The breakfast was pretty basic and a bit of a letdown. I believe it was included in the cost for my room. But I would not recommend paying extra for it. So the location was great and quiet. But the deal breaker for me was the bed. I stayed at Shibuya Granbell for a week and had not a single good night’s sleep, which is the point of a hotel in the end. However, if you don’t mind hard beds and don’t plan on eating breakfast, this is a great place to stay.

I had a single room which was pretty tiny and I only just fitted my 2 bags in however it was clean, modern and functional. Bed wasn't overly comfortable. Great shower and bathroom. Check in staff were able to speak English well and were very helpful providing a map of the local area. Breakfast was simple but everyone was well looked after and fussed over. Pizza restaurant downstairs was always busy but I didn't get a chance to eat there.Great location and only a short walk to the station, Shibuya crossing or the airport limousine stop. I would definitely stay here again.
user_name:
Heatherjaffrey
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: I really liked this hotel, the staff were great - they made a few dinner reservations for us (due to our lack of Japanese language skills). The hotel itself is clean and modern, the room was great. The BEST thing was the powerful water pressure in the shower!! Probably some of the best showers i've ever had, it felt like getting a massage!!
user_name:
D C
Dubai, United Arab Emirates

review_body: We visited this hotel during our visit to Tokyo and the staff could not have been nicer, our room was incredible with a spiral staircase and an amazing view of the city. We used the hotel as a base to explore the city and found the location very convenient for everything that we wanted to do.

Wonderful hotel in a wonderful. Easy walking distance to Shibuya station and drop off point from Narita Airport Bus. Despite works on station expansion it is quiet and incredibly comfortable despite small rooms. Incredibly clean and the staff were wonderful. Would recommend and certainly return.

The location is terrific though a little more challenging right now given the pre-Olympic construction in the area. GoogleMaps is also a bit unpredictable as you move around as well. It’s definitely a tourist hotel - no Japanese here - with mostly large beds (very few double twins) and some very small rooms. There’s a tiny closet for your clothes, small refrigerator, room safe and the regular accoutrements. The staff is very helpful, friendly and accommodating. I would give him high marks especially after our experience at the Granbell Kyoto. There is a small restaurant in front with average food but friendly staff and fast service. We found a nearby laundry for washing as the list prices for hotel service is quite outrageous. Breakfast is passable though it can be crowded in the morning. If you book here, spend a little more for a larger room. Even with this, we had to place our luggage out on the balcony as there wasn’t enough space in the room.

We chose to stay at this hotel for the first leg of our Japan trip primarily of the location. It was a bit confusing figuring out where the hotel was when we arrived at Shibuya station. Just a tip - it's best to exit from the West entrance/exit as that's the closest to get to the hotel.The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful during our stay. They made dinner reservations for us in Kyoto as I don't know how to speak Japanese. They even called the hotel we were heading to; to let them know about our dinner reservations.The room like most hotels in Tokyo is quite small. However, it didn't bother us as we only went then to sleep, shower, and rest. What really turned us off was when we figured out the toilet was giving off a sewage smell. Upon leaving the toilet lid open one day, we noticed the washroom had a bad smell. We didn't know what it was until we were able to match the smell to a sewage smell when we were walking around the city. The only way to keep the smell from spreading is to keep the toilet lid closed and the bathroom. I didn't enjoy using the bathroom in the hotel.There is construction happening across from the hotel but it didn't bother us. They only work during business hours and during those times we were out and about anyways.I would recommend this hotel if you're staying in Shibuya as the price is fair. Just hopefully you don't get a sewage smelling toilet.

The Shibuya Granbell Hotel feels like a classic three and a half star hotel - we enjoyed our stay here and have very few complaints. The service and location definitely gives you bang for your buck. The location is definitely the best selling point of the hotel - a short 4 minute walk to Shibuya Station and surrounded by eateries. You’ll be right in the middle of the action. Still, rooms were quiet and we didn’t have issues with noise from outside, despite some construction happening across the road. The service was great and staff were very helpful. The hotel was modern and had all the amenities you will need. While room sizes are small, this is to be expected in Japan no matter where you go. The rooms were modern in their fit out and very clean. The bed was comfortable and there was some storage space, and the room used the space efficiently (we were in a modern double bedroom). My recommendation is to pack a small to medium sized suitcase when traveling in Japan for this reason. My only complaint was the breakfast, which was quite limited and only had a small selection of dishes. If you’re considering booking with breakfast I’d say go without - I’m sure you’ll find better options right around the corner from where you are. Otherwise, I’d recommend the Shibuya Granbell Hotel!

The check-in process was very quick and easy. We arrived a little early but they were happy to hold our suitcases until our room was ready. Our room was located on the 3rd floor, and while we did hear some construction noise, it didn't bother us.The room itself was basic but perfect for our needs. The bathroom was clean and a great selection of free toiletries were available. The shower is also lovely for a budget hotel. We were planning on spending much time in the room anyway and only stayed two nights, but if you were I can imagine the size might get a bit difficult, but as I said for us it was perfect. The staff were very helpful on the desk! Only downside was the breakfast was a bit of a poor show. Not too much bother but if you are considering whether or not to book the breakfast option, I wouldn't bother. Plenty of restaurants outside that you can go to!

We stayed here for three nights at the beginning of our stay in Japan. The location was perfect - very close to the station and the famous Shibuya crossing. It was clean, bed was comfortable and shower was hot. No complaints there. However, one thing..... Massive construction work happening right outside our window which started at 8am every morning. Didn't bother us too much as we were up early to go exploring but there was no mention of it or apologies. Not the hotel's fault but not ideal.

I stayed in a single, smoking room. The room was fairly basic and cozy, but I felt the standard of amenities were above what one would expect for the price I paid - especially in a large modern mega-city such as Tokyo. I was provided with bottled water, fresh toiletries (toothpaste and toothbrush, shampoo, conditioner, body wash and shower sponge, comb, toilet paper). These were replaced as required when the room was serviced each day. The room was serviced each day between 11am and 2pm. I was very happy with the standard of cleanliness provided each day. It was like coming back to a whole new hotel room. The shower and the toilet were also very clean.Laundry service is available and your items will be returned to you on the same day if you give them to the front desk by 9am.A/C was provided in my room with settings between 19C and 30C.Free Wifi was provided. The internet connection was stable and fast. TV is also provided.The free breakfast is provided by Saku La Dining, and their morning buffet has a variety of different foods such as sausages, bacon, scrambled eggs, french toast, rice, braised chicken and vegetables, cereals, fruit salad, soups and fish. The man who runs the breakfast was very friendly. There is some construction going on at Shibuya Station, although I did not hear it at all from my room, which was on the 12th floor (I was in a room closest to the construction but perhaps being so high up prevented me from hearing it).A vending machine is provided in the hotel.It is close to Shibuya station. From there you can quickly get to other places in Tokyo and the wider area (eg, Narita airport, Ginza, Shinjuku, SkyTree, Odaiba even Yokohama!). Although on the way to the station you do have to navigate a somewhat narrow and inconvenient pedestrian overpass to go over (though it looks like it is in the process of being replaced by a wider pedestrian overpass so that may make things better). There are lifts though so if you get sick of climbing the stairs to go to and from Shibuya station each day or have lots of luggage, you can use that. Nearby are several conbini. the closest is a Family Mart just before the pedestrian overpass. Further up the hill and around the corner a bit is a 7/11 with international atms so you can get cash if needed. I also believe there is a Lawson near the 7/11.If you are a smoker/vaper like me, definitely get a smoking room as smoking/vaping wily-nily outside on the street is now frowned upon in Japan and the nearest outdoor smoking spot that I knew of is all the way by the Moyai statue at Shibuya station. An ashtray is provided (but for obvious reasons - DO NOT smoke in bed!) and replaced when the room is serviced.Overall, I was very impressed with the standards of this hotel and would definitely like to stay here again next time I'm in Tokyo.

Booked last minute to stay at this hotel as we arrived in the early hours of the morning and we needed a place to sleep for a few hours until moving to our other hotel. Officially this is the smallest hotel room I have ever seen. It smelled of tobacco and the view looked over a demolished building -to say the least was unattractive. I wouldn’t be happy staying there if I had booked for longer but a couple of hours sleep and a shower served the purpose.

Very happy with our choice of hotel for our stay in Tokyo. The staff was very polite and helpful. The room size was good for Tokyo, especially this central. Short 5 min walk to Shibuya Station and Shibuya crossing.The included breakfast was ok. Eggs, fish, rice, diffrent cereals, bacon, sausages. All you need to start the day. Coffee and Tea as well. One drawback is a construction site close to the hotel. It was pretty noisy at times during the day, and some working during the night. But this is not the hotels fault, they cant move the hotel can they ? Was thinking of asking for another room further away from the noise, but could not be bothered. You get used to it, and after a while you don't notice it anymore.All in all, very satisfied with our stay. Would probably stay here again for next visit. Stayed for 13 nights in April.

My husband and I booked this room for 4 nights while in Tokyo. It is a short walk from Shibuya Station but because of major construction you have to go up and down a couple flights of stairs to get to the street where the hotel is. If you have a big suitcase prepare to haul it. It’s a little hard to find the entrance also. If you’re going up the street that it’s on, it’s on the left side between first a noodle shop and then a pizza place. The entrance is a giant wooden door set back a bit from the street. Front desk was nice and fast. The room was a decent size for Japan. Major problem though was the a/c. There is none. We called the front desk and they sent up a guy to use a tool to open the window. It was in the 40’s while we were there so it helped but......there is MAJOR construction on one side of the hotel that goes all night into the morning. Request a room away from this side because this project is nowhere close to being finished. The free breakfast was really good and they even have salad and soup! The location is great! Close to everything. There’s a 500 yen pizza place next door and a Family Mart right around the corner. Also the department store Tokyu has a amazing food level called Food Show. The best strawberries even in my life!

We had the Granbell booked for 5 nights for our Honeymoon. We spent a bit extra than we usually would and booked a suite. When we checked in we were disappointed that our room was on the 8th floor basically parallel to major construction (super loud and not relaxing) I went back down to reception and asked if we could be moved to a quieter room due to it being our honeymoon. She was fantastic and told me she would see what she could do and get back to me. Before long we were moved to the other side of the hotel, on the 13th floor into a suite even better then the one we had. I wish I caught her name because she was really lovely and brought us a bottle of wine later to congratulate us. Thank you for the great stay!

Our family stayed for 4 days at this hotel last april 4 to 7, the staff were kind and the room is adequate enough to accommodate us. It is near everything in Shibuya. Convenient stores and restos are nearby.Strategically located and cost is okay. With a minor default in their air-conditioning system the place is still oksy.

We ended our trip with 3 nights at this hotel and it was the one we liked least of five.Our room felt a little bit worn and in need of refurbishment. We also found it excessively hot and the humidifier provided was quite ineffectual in cooling it down. That said, the bed was comfortable and the shower hot and powerful.Unlike other hotels we stayed in, Granbell had individual wifi for each room, which seemed to be a bonus. We however had no end of trouble with it throughout our stay and had to go to the lobby to research for our day. The hotel staff visited our room two or three times over our short stay to try and rectify the problem.Breakfast was provided and whilst the range was limited, it was good quality and included a mixture of local and Western options.Location-wise the hotel is just 5mins walk from Shibuya station and there are plenty of nearby restaurants. At present there is a lot of work on the streets and we did struggle to find the place, as Google maps didn’t play ball.If I visit Tokyo again I would likely choose stay somewhere else.

A five minute walk from the Hachiko Memorial Statue and Shibuya Crossing, this boutique hotel is located in the heart of Shibuya. It provides easy access to Shibuya Station and the Yamanote Line, which enables transport to the rest of Tokyo. From Haneda Airport, you can take the "Friendly Limousine Bus" to the Cerulean Tower Tokyu Hotel and walk to Shibuya Granbell.There are English-speaking staff on hand and they're great overall. The rooms are small, but very clean. All rooms include a complementary "Handy" smartphone for use during your stay. Our reservation included a breakfast buffet which was delicious.My one complaint during my stay would be the A/C. My thermostat was set to 21C (70F), but it felt more like 27C (80F). I informed the staff, who attributed it to being unusually warm that day. They offered to unlock my window so that I could get some fresh air in. But that didn't address the A/C issue! It was cooler the next day, but my room was still hot. I would stay here again only if the A/C issues were resolved.

The hotel's position is excellent. The rooms are clean and staff helpful. Unfortunately there is currently a building site opposite which, despite assurances to the hotel about operating hours from the developers, was in operation until 4am. My room overlooked the site and my sleep was severely disrupted. I would advise a room at the rear of the hotel until work is complete. Breakfast might not be to western tastes but that's what travel is all about....new experiences...I enjoyed it.

The location of this hotel was ideal, only 5-7 minutes from the Shibuya station (be warned that there are steps and over the street walkways involved currently on that path). The staff were nice, and room size was fine, great for a solo traveler. There was some damage to my room on arrival, though, and staining on the floor. The bathroom and linens seemed clean, but the overall room just needed some repairs. Would stay here again for the location, though!

The location of this hotel is amazing, 3' walk from Shibuya crossing. The location justifies the price of the room so do not expect much from the room itself.The hotel itself is ok, we booked the Annex Single room which I'm surprised is an option for 2 people as it is as tiny as it gets. We each had one small luggage that we had to keep packed at all times, otherwise there wasn't any space to walk to the bed. We knew however that the room would be this small and we barely spent any time inside so it wasn't a problem. Our only complaint was regarding the bathroom which was right behind the bed. The bathroom doesn't have any concrete walls around it, but glass. There is a light curtain that you can draw for privacy. The problem was only during the night, if you wanted to get up and visit the bathroom, you would definitely wake up the other person in the room when you switched on the light.

My boyfriend and I stayed here in March. Really recommend if you are staying in shibuya as it is close to the train station and also an easy walk to shibuya crossing and even Harajuku. When you are trying to find the hotel, make sure you look at their website and click the Access page, it gives you pictures of how to get to the hotel from the station. If you are new to Tokyo and you are starving, drop your bags off and go straight to CoCo curry which is a chain restaurant serving amazing katsu curry! It’s a must while you are in Japan and there is one within a two minute walk from the hotel. Recommend this hotel for a couple, it’s quiet, comfortable and a great location!

Appalled by the standard of customer service you receive here, you have to carry ur own luggage up, no phone greetings when you call in, no basic greetings when you enter or leave even though the front office team saw you. This small hotel is more suitable for individual business traveller who is looking for fast n convenient accommodation, located very near JR station. Very tight room space, toilet is alright. Aircon are fixed & standarized at heating function only, for cool air you can only choose to open window and very unfortunately noisy since I am placed at 3rd storey. Considerably affordable with very basic breakfast, just do not expect Japanese standard level of service here.

Good location close to station. Good access via overhead walkway across busy streets (elevators). Helpful staff.Rooms are tight but very functional. Bathroom is a good size with all necessities supplied. Very clean.Plenty of restaurants and bars close by. Short walk to trendy shopping, restaurant and bar district.Breakfast was very basic but included in price.Would return again.

Near location to the station, among shops and restaurants around this hotel.Easy transport to reach this hotel. Free wifi, and staffs can speak english and easy to speaking. One of the famous tourist destination around here Shibuya Crossing .

The hotel is plain Jane – not much of a lobby, the hallways and rooms are vanilla, no amenities to speak of, etc. BUT:- the location is less than five minutes away from the station- the rooms are clean- the breakfast was good- the staff was courteous and friendly- cheaper than most other Shibuya hotels- several bars and restaurants near the hotelIf you want a clean hotel room at a reasonable price this is an excellent choice. It's away from the "action", but a short walk (less than five minutes to the station / about five minutes to the cross walk) and you'll have all of the action you want.

Granbell hotel is conviently located near the Shibuya train station and the famous Shibuya crosswalk with ample food and entertainment option near by. The hotel itself has everything you need from free WiFi to a Buffett breakfast and even a restaurant/bar in the lobby. The staff is friendly and they speak English well enough to communicate with English speaking guests. I would definitely recccommend the Granbell Hotel!

We found this hotel to be very well located to the station, it was great value for money including breakfast, the staff were so helpful and polite. The staff went beyond their normal service by even helping us take our luggage to the station. It was comfortable too. It has a great noodle restaurant nearby

My wife and I flew to Tokyo and stayed at the Shibuya Grandbell hotel for five days, then went to Kyoto, Hiroshima and Kamakura before returning to Shibuya and the Grandbell. I would heartily recommend this hotel to anyone in the Shibuya/Tokyo area. Clean, quiet and a great staff.

I stayed in this hotel for 2 night on November 2018. If you want a decent hotel in a central location near Shibuya this is your hotel.I will stay here again if i would come back again to Tokyo.Pros- Location is superb, 5 minutes from Shibuya pedestrian crossing- Hotel has free coffee and water in reception- Room is very small- Hotel offer from free a smartphone with internet connection and free local calls to use during your stay- Staff is very kind and politeCons- Breakfast is terrible.

I hope this hotel will do some effort. The service was ok, but no more. Honestly, my room was just dirty, very dirty. The cleaning lady forgot a Koro-Koro (sticky roll to stick dust) in the corridor, so I used it in my room … well, it catches so many hairs from different lengths and colors plus nails bites that I was disgusted. This room has not seen a vacuum cleaner for several weeks or months.Definitely, I will not recommend you that hotel. Some Capsule hotels are more fun to stay and are clean!

I was a little hesitant booking the Shibuya Granbell based on some the of reviews but was pleasantly surprised. We booked premium rooms and found them to be more than adequate for our needs. The location was perfect to access the Shibuya Line Station and only a few minutes to the centre of Shibuya.As others have mentioned, the breakfast gets a little dull after a few days but it is still good. We loved the Handy phones in the room that were complimentary during our stay.Overall a good solid hotel.

I booked this hotel on 1/5 Japan time afternoon, and mistakenly set the dates from 1/5-1/8 instead of 1/6-1/8 as originally intended. I called the hotel within a few minutes of making the booking to correct the error, and ask for the first day of the stay to be refunded, since I will not be arriving until 1/6. After being placed on a hold for 25 minutes, the answer was an absolute "no" because "it is the rules." Of course, at that point there was no way I can stay there happily for the two nights as I was initially planned, and website allowed me to cancel the booking altogether while forfeiting $113 paid for the first night's stay. Once I told that to the hotel receptionist, probably realizing that the hotel will actually make less money now than if they just allowed me to cancel the first night, she outright lied to me and said "you will need our permission to cancel, or we will charge you for the second night as well." While I consider it extremely unreasonable and an awful customer service to not allow me to fix a booking mistake I made just minutes ago (also there were plenty of rooms available, the hotel did not incur any loss), I can understand that I am the one who made the mistake. However, it is inexcusable as well as unprofessional to flat out deceive a customer to get them to stay, especially after using the "rules" as an excuse for being so inflexible. Needless to say, I will never stay in this hotel again. There was always a problem with the attitudes of the staffs but the location and the facility was ok, but now it only reminds me of their awful and deceptive customer service. They decided that keeping my $113 was more worth it than keeping me as a customer...

Good location, very near to Shibuya station. The website access guide gives good instructions. Service was nice and polite. Room however was not too new and design very much like hourly hotel. They offer short day stay rates as well. Okay to stay a night but not for long. Toilet was clean and no odd smells which was good. Overall okay given its location.

We stayed two nights at this hotel the location of which is spectacular, it is within 5 minutes walk of Shibuya crossing. The room presented well. However, the bed was hard and uncomfortable. Furthermore, the temperature is centrally controlled, this gave us no opportunity to manage the room’s temperature other than to have our window open letting in street and construction noise which made sleep difficult.

The location of the hotel is very central to the JR and the metro so easy to navigate the transport system in Tokyo. Lots of great eateries walking distance from the hotel which is super convenient. The hotel os very much a 3 star and lives up to that. The rooms are comfortable however small in size which is standard for Tokyo. It was okay for our needs for 4 nights.The breakfast provided is poor. The buffet breakfast has a limited selection and compared to other places we have stayed in Japan (3 stars) did not meet our expectations. The set menu options were also not the best as limited selection and the western option was a small portion of instant eggs and 3 pieces of bacon with tomato sauce. The Japanese style option was the best for taste, serving size and quality. The room service menu is limited to pizzas which are great in flavor however would be nice to have more of a variety. Overall the hotel under delivered on the price paid for the stars it claims to be. However the location is the best feature.

It is right outside the Shibuya station making it incredibly convenient to travel Tokyo. I booked a single room and it was big enough for 1 person just fine. Staff is friendly and multilingual. Breakfast is included with the room.

amazing! perfect location near shibuya station, but on a quiet side street. staff couldn't be nicer! great with dinner suggestions- right on point for local food! quiet hotel. excellent breakfast! room for single was well appointed- no view, but not necessary.

The Granbell felt in some ways more like a hostel than a hotel. The lobby was a bit of a mess with empty crates, chairs piled up and a general air of backpachers. However many other aspects were in line with a stylish boutique hotel starting with the excellent desk service. The room we had was ok sized with good bed great shower, fluffy towels, slippers, bathrobes etc There was an empty minibar, a very handy free mobile phone with internet connection to take out of the room - free of charge - but on the downside not much space to move around in or to put stuff. The included breakfast was nothing to write home about but unlike in all the other hotels we saw it was free and you could opt for a cooked breakfast upstairs or just coffee and toast in the ground floor café. This café had the most amazing thin crust pizzas - almost as good as our ones back home in Rome! Plus a god atmosphere and some outside seating. All in all we enjoyed our stay despite the rain and Shibuya is crazy - probably would stay in another neighbourhood next time. The Granbell however is not noisy but on a side street away from the crowds.

For a short stay in Tokyo before catching our last leg home to Malaysia from USA. This isn’t in the upscale institutional area of international hotels. Situated in an uphill quaint lane, this place tries to put together a bit of quirky style with first class comfort.Checking in was a breeze. Our floor only house 4 rooms. Ours was very large. Heavenly twin beds and all those little comforts equipped in true Japanese fashion. The Shibuya crossing which was nearby together with the statue of Hachiko delighted the tourist part in us. Location was only a three minute walk from the metro station. Loads of great authentic food places and bars. Hotel was very clean. We chose the Japanese option for breakfast!

Stayed here for 4 nights on a recent solo trip. The room for 1 is small but comfortable and clean. The hotel is very conveniently located, 5 min walk from Shibuya station, and there is a nearby alighting/drop-off point for the bus from the airport. It was very easy both with luggages and for getting around! The hotel staff spoke good English and replied emails in English, which was really helpful, and they also helped with restaurant reservations and receiving packages. Thank you! Enjoyed my stay very much!

Great service from the staff!Great, quiet stay in the middle of Shibuya!Nice room with bathtub and shower.Japanese breakfast was good.The yakitori pizza in the restaurant was great!Combini a few steps away. Nice neighborhood.

2nd time here due to the location and the fact that they give you free breakfast! We ate the Japanese breakfast again every day that were were here. The bed was the biggest throughout our stay in Japan and had the best bathroom. I recommend to everyone

Very convenient location a short walk away from Shibuya station and its several metro lines. Rooms size is ok, not 'big' but not smaller than elsewhere in central Tokyo in this rathe moderate price range. All-in-all, an excellent base to explore the city. Tip: On the top floor, the hotel has a few suites,including one with a mezzanine bath tub offering a view of the city and a small terrace. Check (at booking or arrival) if the hotel proposes discounts. I indulged and stayed there one of the nights of my stay and must say it was well worth the extra expense!

Great location, short walk to Shibuya station and crossing, lots shopping and eating options. Room in annex (which appeared newer than tower) very compact, no bath, bed access from one side only, clean with all facilities, staff provided good service and had reasonable English. Good value with breakfast included, not great breakfast menu but it satisfied our needs. Evening pizzas on ground floor were a welcome menu change. Best feature was the shower after long day of walking, disappointment was the cost of laundry at $10/shirt.

The hotel is in a great location. Front desk is nice and helpful. They provide a lot of great recommendations for restaurants, places to visit, and shops. The hotel is a 5 minute walking distance to the Shibuya station.

Small hotel but 5 min walk from Shibuya station. Very quiet even though it was close to bars and restaurants and all the happening places in Shibuya. Good value and recommend the Japanese breakfast as it was delicious. Arigato!

The rooms were tiny but the location made it a solid spot to check out the city. Close by the Shibuya Station made travel easy, and outside the doors of the hotel you can find plenty of bars and restaurants. But, the rooms were tiny and don’t play any english or subtitles on the TV.
user_name:
james_dorsin
New York City, New York

review_body: This was an adequate hotel which had a great price. We find the location great also and indeed it was a few minutes from the crowded Shibuya area. Also the train station was right there. At this hotel we had a corner room which used the space a bit differently than the photos I see online. We could both access the bed on each side because it was not up against the wall... but it was a bit tight walking on my side of the bed. Room had a small fridge. 7-11 close by for drinks and snacks. For my taste I found the room a bit tired. It was tidy but the bathroom could have been a bit cleaner. Toilet was also not the best model. If we were to stay again I would investigate another room. The rooms airconditioner was good. I am never a fan of particle board furniture but maybe I need to upgrade my room and pay more. I found the hotel staff a bit aloof and not really approachable, we were offered no information on where to find things. Found out later there might have been another door on the otherside of the hotel. The buffet breakfast, as mentioned by others, was pretty bad. During the day they make “pizzas” which I tried once with a beer. Very unfriendly place. The restaurant we never looked for or really knew where it was. Just down the street a good place to eat dinner and Renoir is a great place to get coffee and toast or even a layered cake, with a quiet sitting area. We would return but will investigate a room upgrade, as some of the online pictures seem to be much nicer, and we found the area great.

Firstly, the air conditioning here is fantastic. We stayed here during the warmest ever days on record in Japan's history and the air con was a god send and worked fantastically.The staff were all professional. Managed to print off my boarding pass no problem were very helpful with that.The room itself is a bit too cosy but they do utilise the space well. Great Japanese high tec toilet also. Shower was great. Air con was great too. Bed was comfy.What steals the show here however is the handy mobile device they give. I had broken my phone just before coming here and we couldnt use our phones in Japan due to the extortionate cost so when we saw these little things, boy did I jump for joy! Handysmart i think they are called and they are basically a mobile phone with internet, google maps etc that you can use internet for! Fantastic idea!The location is just the best. 5 minute walk to Shibuya crossing and the train station. The bus station is confusing as heck though.Also, if you want to go to mount fuji, there is a bus at the Silver Mark City (i think thats its name) that takes you there and back. Book online if you can. Save money.The breakfast. Ok there are two options. A buffet that was just pointless (we saw it and just walked back out), they had nothing of note there. The second is the restuarant. We used it once and, top service from the very friendly Japanese staff but it was not really all that great. That said, it was free so im not complaining.Overall, great spot. Solid area.
user_name:
skjordan
Brighton and Hove, United Kingdom

review_body: We just concluded a four night stay here. We had two rooms on the same floor, which was much appreciated as I had three teenagers under my charge. You can’t ask for a better location- just minutes from the west exit (follow the signs for the South Gate - not the NEW South Gate and eventually you will see the directions to the west exit). Once you cross the pedestrian overpass you are pretty much there. 7-11 and Family Mart are both very close by as well as lots of small coffee shops and places to eat, including some that are open 24 hours. Despite it being so close to the heart of Shibuya, it is surprisingly quiet and an excellent place to put up your feet after being on the go all day. There are mini-fridges cleverly tucked away under the desk, and a really great shower. Sure, the rooms are small (this is Tokyo, after all), but so well Laid our that it doesn’t matter. I also appreciated the minimalist, serene decor. There’s also a nice little area off the lobby with tables, comfy seating and free coffee and tea. A couple of nights we just had our take out dinner here, while planning the next day’s itinerary. 10/10, I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Excellent hotelFree breakfast- option of American style buffet on first floor with brews, eggs and sausage. A la carte on the second floor with option of Japanese style breakfast or French toast or western styleWe have a double premium rooms on the third floor rm 306 and 305. The beds were king size! So huge! Huge bathroom with rain shower head. Daily Pajamas and slippers provided. Free coffee , teas and water around the front desk. They can store your luggage on check in and check out so you can still see the city. Close to Shibuya Station and Shibuya crossing. Lots of shopping and restaurants within walking distance. Family mart was close by and we bought drinks and food there. Very nice staff especially Diana who helped us with taxis and dinner reservations. Thank you Diana ! Highly recommended. We loved the hotel.So close to everything and such a wonderful room and comfortable bed.Room amenities include hair dryer, toothbrush and toothpaste, hair brush, shaver, shampoo conditioner and bath gel. I was afraid of the bed size and small rooms that people were saying about Japan but this exceeded our expectations .Huge bed and room with excellent free wifi.

The Shinjuku Granbell Hotel is a good hotel in a not-so-good location. The Shibuya Granbell is a so-so hotel in a great location, about 300 meters from the West Exit of Shibuya Station. The hotel itself is comfortable enough, with a small lobby that is accessed by a very cool, very large door. My room on the 9th floor was small but functional. The bathroom took up nearly the same amount of space as the room and is separated by a glass wall. What I didn’t like about the room was that the bed faces the see through bathroom, which means the room has a view...of the toilet. Apart from that I found my room quiet, something I always appreciate. I tried breakfast in both of the restaurants. To say that they were minimal at best is an understatement. While I liked the location of the hotel, with plenty of restaurants just outside the hotel, and quick access to Shibuya station, I thought the Shibuya Granbell was pretty average.

We visit Japan every year, and this hotel has become our go-to in Tokyo. They have another location in Shinjuku which we've stayed at as well; we prefer Shibuya for our home base in Tokyo. Both hotels are great, and notably decent prices for a quality hotel in such high-demand locations. The Granbell Shibuya is simply in a perfect location -- just a few minutes' walk from Shibuya station but on a quieter street in Sakuragaocho, so you're both in the heart of the action and slightly insulated from it. Makes it very easy if you're getting off the airport train to haul your bags just a couple of blocks. Just outside the Granbell are a number of cute little izakaya and restaurants, so you don't have to even go over to the busier side of Shibuya to get a good meal. There's a Family Mart and a Lawson's within a block as well, so you are fully covered for convenience. We've stayed in a number of different rooms -- we were delighted on our most recent visit when they gave us a surprise upgrade to the splendid Executive Suite -- and have always been pleased. Like most Tokyo hotel rooms, they are much smaller than comparable hotel rooms in North America, but that's to be expected in Japan. More importantly, the rooms are relaxing and well-appointed, with nice bathrooms and comfortable beds. The service at the hotel has always been outstanding for us, with welcoming and helpful staff. One small downside is they have no on-site laundry, though they do have a laundry service. The pizza restaurant on the main floor is great, though we did have poor service when we went there for dinner -- a rarity in Japan, where you'll generally have outstanding service anywhere you go. Oh well. There's also a nice Japanese breakfast on the second-floor restaurant, with a Western option as well. (Take the Japanese. You didn't go all that way just to eat toast and eggs, did you?) A side note, especially for Western travellers: hotel loyalty rewards programs in Japan are superb compared to their Western counterparts. Make sure to book through the main Granbell site and make yourself an account. Your points accumulate quickly and can be used for nice discounts on future visits. We love this hotel and will be back next time we are in Tokyo.

I stayed here for just one night due to my very long layover. Great location. Walking distance to metro and narita express train. Room was clean and bed was very comfortable. Every staff member in this hotel was absolutely the best. Such a respectful, courteous, professional and a fantastic staff. I also forgot some personal belongings in the room and before I was able to discover that they already emailed me and also left me a voicemail on my phone. These guys are the best! They were able to pack and ship it to me without any issues. I will definitely come back to this hotel!

Upside 1. Close to everything - shopping, eating, convenience stores, train2. Rooms are bigger than usual and always tidy; hip looking hallways 3. Lobby has helpful maps and prints outs for travelers + the main door looks quirky4. English speaking Front Desk Officer available5. Quick Check In experience, real hassle free6. Outside the hotel, lots of eating places apart from the hotel's inhouse restaurants 7. Cute room decor. Compact but well thought out8. A few minutes walk to the bus stop for airport transfer which makes it so convenient and way more affordable than booking a cab to the airport9. Shampoo, toiletries, etc - smells so good10. Linens and towels - looks new and smells fresh, just the way we like it!DownsideNone :)

I stayed in a single room which, as expected, is very tiny and within Japanese standards. Everything was compact but I had everything I needed. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom has a relaxing rainshower and that great Toto washlet. The lighting was a little too dark for my tastes and you can't pull the window blinds up in the bathroom because there is no window tint.Breakfast was included (a choice between two restaurants and my favourite was the traditional Jap breakfast). The location is great because its literally a few minutes' walk from Shibuya station, yet in a quiet area that has konbini and restaurants. I would definitely stay here again.

This hotel is really great . I stayed here 7 nights. Travelling solo, room was good and fonctionnal. They provide everyday shampoo ... bottle of water.There is also a small fridge.Staff is really helpfullGreat location, very close to everything.

Very central to many of Tokyo's highlights and still quiet and peaceful so that you can wind down. Had a great Ramen around the corner in a place playing reggae music. Very surprising to say the least.

I always stay at the granbell when in Tokyo. Fantastic staff at the front desk and always willing to help. Just a few small things some of the rooms need a good dust as the lamps and air conditioning vents clearly show that they haven’t been cleaned in a while. Also the front restaurant made us feel unwelcome one night as we were forced to sit outside even though there were tables inside free. It could have been a miscommunication as my Japanese is very rusty and broken. Overall I really enjoyed my stay and the gentleman serving breakfast in the Level 2 restaurant made my morning something to look forward to as he always explained the dishes and was very kind about my broken Japanese.

This hotel is in the heart of everything Shibuya has to offer,Was welcomed by staff at reception,and proceeded to our room very quickly.Room was small,but adequate for short stay.Had no problems at all with stay at hotel.If you are traveling to this hotel by train,take the west Hachiko exit at Shibuya station.It is a 5minute walk to the hotel.Shibuya crossing,shops,restaurants,pubs and cafes are all 7-10minutes away from hotel.

You’d be hard pressed to find a more frustrating guest stay experience than in Shibuya Granbell Hotel. Throw away all positive imprsssions of Japanese culture (efficiency, excellent customer service, etc) because this hotel is a complete betrayal of all that’s good about Tokyo.I requested for a late checkout extension of 1 hour (from 11am to 12noon) and was told that I needed to pay for this extension. There was zero wiggle room for a complimentary extension, which I frankly find ridiculous. I requested for an hour, not a week. 60+ cities and counting later, this is the absolute first time my simple and frankly not unreasonable request has been met with such blatant inflexibility and rudeness.Breakfast here was deplorable. Cold, tepid eggs, tuna from a can and an indifferent counter staff made the start of every morning unpleasant. Even by Tokyo standards, the rooms were ridiculously cramped, and not as impeccably maintained as one would come to expect from Tokyo. Stained tiles and a putrid smell from the shower curtains were evident when I first stepped in to the room.Hideous. Avoid at all costs. If I could give this abomination of an establishment zero stars, I bloody would.

We stayed here for three nights at the start of our Japanese holiday. The location is ideal - so many eateries, shopping options; nightlife and bars within seconds but just slightly removed from the hectic Shibuya crossing. The Airport Limousine from Narita drops you off nearby and of course Shibuya station can get you almost anywhere.The rooms are compact - I’d have liked a little more space, but that’s expected in Japan. Breakfast decent and service very helpful. I’d happily stay here again if I was coming back to Tokyo.

My husband and I booked a double in the annex. We had read several reviews saying that the rooms in the annex were too small and were dirty... that couldn't be anything farther than the truth. Yeah sure, there were scuffs in the walls, but when they're right by where you store your luggage, scuffs are going to happen!Anyway, we got to the hotel via limo bus to cerulean hotel and we were able to find the hotel easily. Check in was a breeze and the people at the front desk spoke excellent English. Front desk was also more than happy to help us book reservations.Again, our room was clean and yes, while small, it wasn't so small that it was unbearable. We were able to fit our 4 suitcases and 4 carry-ons after some creative tetris. We had access to the desk the whole time. My 6 ft husband was able to sleep in the bed comfortably.The room even came with a smartphone for us to use. So very useful! Each room also had it's own wifi, so the speed of the internet was excellent. The bathroom has everything from soaps to hairbrushes and everything used was refilled daily. Also, the shower stream was nice and powerful and the toilet seat was heated. The breakfasts also were really nice! I really liked the Japanese breakfasts a lot and tried to get it as often as I could. By the end of the trip, one of the employees recognized me and knew exactly what I wanted. The buffet at cona wasn't too bad either. I really liked the mini bagel bits. The location was excellent, we were right outside the madness of Shibuya, but also close enough so that the station was a stone's throw away. The nights were nice and quiet and we heard virtually nothing when we went to bed.This was an excellent hotel and I'm so glad that we got to stay here! We're ready to come back! <3

Booked here for our last two nights in Tokyo after seeing many good reviews on this hotel. The room was outdated, seemed unclean with furniture/chairs that had markings on it and also very dimly lit and did not have a welcoming vibe to it. We had requested for a non-smoking room but was given a smoking room that stunk, even the corridors had a rink to it - very unpleasant for non smokersI was not too fussed with all that until on the day of check out I had stomach pains so was in the rest room for longer than intended - I ended up been 12 mins late for check out. The receptionist told me there was a late check out fee while the manager (guy that looked like the manager) stood behind her without saying one word he typed 2500 (yen) in the calculator and put it in front of me. There was no sympathy in him as I questioned why I was billed a bit over 30 aud for been 12 minutes late when they couldn’t even give me a non smoking room when I had requested for one - he stared at me with a look on his face and not one word came out of him, even when I decided to pay the $31.25 to get it over and done with. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, and will never stay with any of the Granbell hotels after this situation. However I got to say the receptionists were nice. I recommend you stay at Shibuya excel if you are looking for the best location, right on top of Shibuya train station with views of the Shibuya crossing for the same price point.

Don't get fooled by paying a little less to stay at the Shibuya Granbell Hotel, I did it and was a big mistake. The pictures on their website look great and trendy, but only show probably the best rooms, but in reality this hotel is old, outdated, dirty, badly taken care of and run down.When I reserved 3 weeks in advance I specifically asked for a nice room top floor with a view since I'm an architect and care a lot about these things. When I arrived the location was next to the station but not very nice, (it's MUCH better to stay in the north side of the station, there are many options there), the lobby is horrible, they gave me my room which was on the 5th floor and as soon as I got in it was very smelly (old and humid) and with no view, actually yes to a concrete wall 1m apart, I went down to ask for a change and tell them that I had specifically asked for a nice view and said they all were the same and that they were fully booked. So I go back to my cave and open the window to at least let some fresh air in. The restaurants where they serve breakfast are horrible as well, they are old and badly designed, the choice of breakfast is pretty bad and basic, it was so unattractive that I didn't even have breakfast the second day there, you are better off going anywhere else outside of this ruin. So don't be fooled with the breakfast included fare, it's ridiculous!So in conclusion there is really nothing to make it worth to staying here, not even the price, if I were you, stay north of the Shibuya train station, there are so many hotels and new ones like KOE, this was a very big mistake of mine and I feel completely deceived!

Location is genius minutes from the famous Shibuya crossing and the pedestrian street but in a side quiet street the Shibuya Station is minutes walkFriendly hospitable staff They do their best to satisfy their guest on our first night we had a bad smell in the room the receptionist “Hiro”acted promptly and changed the room Also “ Haruka”was quick and punctual in making our tour and explaining where and how to goRoom and bathroom contains all needed and the size is reasonable Cleanliness is to the best standardOnly the breakfast is no good as it is poor in quality ,quantity and presentation This hotel is recommended for its superb location and service

Stayed here for 5 nights recently and would highly recommend it. From Shibuya station make sure you take the West Exit and basically turn left and go up the stairs and straight across and down the stairs. There is a lift pass the stairs to go up for you if you have suitcases. There is also a lift to get down near the hotel but hard to explain without a diagram but keep an eye out on the right. The hotel itself was very nice. Reception can speak english and will keep your luggage if you have arrived early. Travelling solo so the room was adequate with the bathroom basically next to the bed just separated by glass. This hotel has a safe, and provides guests with the necessary toiletries and a bottle of water every day. A little fridge is there too to keep your bottled water cool. Bidet is great as well! Breakfast was included and you could either have a breakfast buffet on the 1st floor or select from 3 types on the 2nd floor. The 1st floor breakfast was your typical scrambled eggs, little sausages, bite size pieces of bagel, fruit juices and cereal. On the 2nd floor you could choose a japanese breakfast (give it a go), a french toast breakfast or a western breakfast of eggs, bacon and toast. Cereal and milk and fuit juices are also available. The layout of the 2nd floor was probably better and I would go the japanese breakfast (but be careful the fish has bones). Great location and nearby Shibuya crossing and with access to the train station you can basically access the other areas of Tokyo. Thumbs up!

We only stayed one night so keep that in mind when reading my review! We like the location of the hotel, it was really close to everything we wanted to do on our last day! We really liked that it was close to the train station, the instructions on where to go from the station to the hotel are spot on, use them! A bar you can access from the hotel with pizzas for 500yen each and drinks starting at 500yen too! The bed was pretty comfortable and the room was small but we opted for the smaller room due to us only staying one night! The layout was cool and efficient enough for us!! Breakfast: You get two options, continental or a pick your meal style breakfast with three options; Japanese Style, or Western (scrambled eggs, toast and meat OR french toast breakfast). We chose option 2 as my boyfriend wanted to try the traditional Japanese breakfast, I wanted to get french toast but it was apparently sold out so i settled for the second western style breakfast and it was gross honestly and not very much food, my boyfriend said his was okay. This kinda sealed the deal on the 3 star review for us! There was ONE waiter and he was overwhelmed handling it all on his own. The self serve juice and coffee station was a mess everything was out and did not even get refilled while we were there. Not a terrible visit but could use improvement big time.

We booked this purely on location and was not disappointed. Very, very close to the train station with direct access to Narita (buy a return trip ticket it is cheaper ¥4000 return or ¥3200 one way). We left the bulk of our luggage at the airport after being on a 22 day cruise (luggage storage ¥530 per lge suitcase per day. Well worth it). The granbell was easy to find. Very close to the mini mart. Staff were very welcoming and helpful. No bell hop so you do have to cart your own stuff. The rooms were tiny but very functional. Bed was huge and surprisingly comfortable. There were no English TV channels, but you could get a movie for ¥1000.The hotel was exceptionally clean. We had to checkout at 5.20am to catch the first train to the airport. The gentleman was very helpful. Breakfast was ok, bearing in mind that it is a foreign country, the essentials were there.This hotel was brilliant for location and the access to Shibuya Crossing and the rest of Tokyo.

Came to this accommodation for my partners birthday. Hotel staff were very nice and the room, although small like all Japanese apartments, had a decent size bathroom. We were also provided with a complimentary breakfast which was good. Definitely recommend staying for a cosy comfort stay.

A functional hotel that has all the basic amenities for our needs. What was good is the location. Good restaurants and station right there. We had a quirky room called "Bear Hotel " fun decor. Service was adequate.

This is the thrid time I've stayed at this hotel, which should tell you everything you need to know. You can't beat it for location: close to Shibuya Station which will get you anywhere in Tokyo fast and easy to reach from either airport. Staff is helpful and friendly and the place is neat and tidy with a quiet room.

We are staying here for 3 nights. When we checked in yesterday the hotel had upgraded us from an Annex double room to a double room which was very nice of them. Also because it is my birthday there was a nice bottle of wine awaiting me in the room. The hotel is comfortable, good beds and pillows, great little bathroom with nice toiletries supplied. TV, Phone, Tea and Coffee making facilities etc There is even a Smart phone in the room that you are allowed to take with you outside while staying here that gives you access to wifi around the city and free calls. As for the location, it is only a few minutes walk from Shibuya train station. It is a little hard to find it at first but the Japanese people are very helpful and we had nice young man walk with us to show us where it was. Very easy to find once you know where it is. There are 100’s if restaurants and bars close by and just 5 minutes walk to the “busiest intersection in the world” and shopping area. Breakfast is nice - not huge but adequate with a selection of either a western breakfast, a French breakfast of a Japanese breakfast in one of the restaurants and a small buffet breakfast in the other restaurant. There is also a bar if you would like a drink. We will definitely stay here again and recommend it.

I read reviews of this hotel and I am perplexed that they are talking about the same hotel we stayed in for one week! Basically, it's a very ordinary hotel, very ordinary. We stayed in a poorly designed room, a dark, poorly designed room, with far too much furniture for the space, a very ordinary bathroom, and everything was old and dated, and dark! We weren't worried about the size of the room, as it is Tokyo, so you don't expect too much space, but after reading many reviews we were convinced it was going to be a great choice. Breakfast which was included with the room price, was very simple and for the first few days, sort of moderately appealing, but eventually we skipped breakfast and waited for lunch. The room itself was just plain ugly, with everything brown, or a version of brown timber, except for the bathroom which was a glass box exposed to the bedroom. For privacy there was a curtain which closed the glass box off to the room, but I am still amused and confused who thought the addition of yellow film on the glass was a good idea. Straight out of the 1970's, but fortunately, most of us, and most hotels, have moved on!Location was a big factor in many reviews, but after traipsing up and down the stairs to get to or from the Shibuya station, you'd really need to question the location as a major factor. We were there in January, when Tokyo had a major snowfall, and the snow only highlighted the fact these stairs to the freeway overpass were a huge obstacle. Yes there is a lift (elevator) up, and down, which was ideal when we had luggage, but the freeway was a major downfall whenever we left the hotel, or returned tired at the end of the day including where we dined of an evening.  Thankfully, around the hotel there were some lovely restaurants which were a Godsend as we didn't have to traverse the freeway to eat over the other side!The staff, as they were everywhere we stayed in Japan, were very pleasant and helpful. They were delightful. We had come having spent a week in the Kyoto Granbell which was fantastic, so this Tokyo version was a major disappointment I'm sorry to say.

We had stayed in Tokyo before and got used to the size of Japanese hotel rooms. This double room had more space than the previous (Apa) and was obviously newly refurbished. The location is great (near Shibuya station, the shopping area and all kinds of bars). All amenities are available (including a kettle with coffee and green tea). Bed is very comfortable and evrything very clean. The only point to improve is breakfast: there are 2 options available, à la carte and buffet, and both do not have much choice. We saw the buffet had a choice of cereals, bread, sausages, scrambled eggs and meat balls only, so we opted for the à la carte with a selection of western/japanese/french. My husband had the western that consisted in scrambled eggs, 3 pieces of bacon and some bread, while I had the japanese which was a bit more assorted (fish, miso, fish, egg, tofu). I would give 5 stars for more choice. For those who do not have breakfast at hotels or need much, this is just perfect.

The hotel was a 5 min walk to shibuya JR station . And 7 min walk to the heart of shibuya . Many great restaurant around the hotel. Staff was friendly and polite. Understand simple English and can respond in English too.. The breakfast at level 2 was a turn down . Not up to expectations. Level 1 breakfast was free flow . Better than level 2 . You can leave your luggage with them if you reach early . Check in time was 2 pm . Room was a smoking room . You can ask them to unlock the window . The annex room was reasonable big for 2 of us . Room was cosy and comfortable. I would choose here again if I am coming to tokyo again .

If you want to be in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Tokyo this hotel is perfect. It’s within walking distance of a great shopping district with lovely restaurants and Shibuya train station is just over the road giving you easy access to the rest of Tokyo. The staff are helpful and speak good English. Breakfast choices are good, traditional Japanese and western, and are enough to set you up for the day. The view from our room was just a wall but we didn’t mind, get out and about to see the sights. It was warm and the beds were cosy, and the shower was lovely and powerful. If you’re looking for somewhere plush and grand go somewhere else. If you just want a place to get your head down you can’t go wrong.

This hotel is in need of a bit of a refurbishment. Rooms were clean but paintwork marked and floors scuffed. Great shower though and separate toilet which was good. Breakfast was served in two areas. Downstairs a sort of makeshift Buffet was set up in the bar or you could be served breakfast in an upstairs room which offered a western, French or Japanese plate. There was also some cereal on offer. Could be improved The Cona bar served food in the evening and pizzas were good. It could be quite buzzy and fun depending who was working. Loads of great wee bars roundabout if you take some time to wander. The hotel is only a few minutes from Shibuya Station (over a flyover) and all the shops etc. I am sure there are better boutique hotels in Tokyo but this is not a bad price for the location. I did not take any pics of the room( too small to get a decent angle!)

Convenient location, just over the bridge from Shibuya station. Moderately priced. We stayed in the bears room (1005) which is quirky and fun. Breakfast (Japanese option) is nice. No frills, but everything you need. I’m not sure I’d stay in the Shibuya area again until the construction around the station is completed (maybe in 2019 or later). It is just one big construction site, although the side streets are interesting.

We booked a standard twin but got upgraded to a superior twin upon arrival, couldn't have asked for more. Loved the room, it was clean, quiet, modern looking, the bathroom was awesome (rain shower yes!!). Amenities were great and the breakfast was really good too. Staff was friendly and the location so close to the station can't get any better. I would definitely come back if I had the chance.

I stayed at the Shibuya Granbell Hotel in mid-December with a friend in a double twin bed room.Overall, the hotel is a solid choice with clean rooms, reliable wi-fi, and a friendly staff. The rooms are nothing special and rather small, although certainly adequate. What really makes this a good choice is the amazing location right in the heart of Shibuya. You can walk to many top attractions in Tokyo and even easily stop back at the hotel during the day for a reset.
user_name:
davidrwolkoff
New York City, New York

review_body: Booked Superior Twin Room (1302) at a great rate 300-350) over NYE and very happy. Decent size by Tokyo standards, and double tall ceiling made it feel even roomier. Room was top floor, had a balcony and its own wifi-network (fast). Espresso machine in the room. Bathroom with (rain) shower and bathtub. Lots of toiletries, bathrobes. Comfy beds with 4 pillows each. No iron in the room, didn’t ask for it so not sure if they would bring up. Location is perfect, right in Shibuya, 3min walk to station. Lots of activity 5min walk away but hotel street is quiet. Time Out Tokyo and Shibuya guides for you in the lobby. Free tea and coffee in lobby any time. Yes, the breakfast sucks. Only tried first floor, maybe better on second floor. Fine if you just want some coffee and toast or cereal. Hot items really bad. Not enough to impact my experience of hotel but management should address.

The hotel room that I stayed (modern double) almost a year ago was spacious and comfortable with a functional yet aesthetically pleasing bathroom. During my stay, housekeepers did a job that just I´d expect.The breakfast was decent with very friendly restaurant staff. On top of all this, I greatly appreciate the front desk officers for their professionalism and whole-souled service. I wanted to stay at this hotel again in last November... no wonder when I found out the hotel was fully booked.My sincere appreciation for your wonderful hospitality. Look forward to staying again in the future.
Nice hotel, nice room.Room are not so big, as usual in japan.Laundry service is OK.Breakfast nothnig specialService is OK.The building itself is not so high so all the room do not have a nice view.

The booking system is not clear and you might get a smoking room if you don’t check it very very carefully. The comfort rooms are so small that you cannot open big luggage. Some rooms have a wall behind fake windows. It smells smoke in corridors. The breakfast is very small and not very good (industrial food not tasty) and the person at the breakfast is not very nice with non Japanese people. The day of the check out, they came in our room at 8:40 while we were sleeping and they called us again 30min later to ask why we were still in the room as someone brought them the keys (which was not the case as we had them with us...). It is nice to be close from shibuya station but there are huge road works around there, making it not very pleasant and really not practical (December 2017). Really to expensive even in Tokyo!

I was here 7 days total. The location is great, 2 blocks from Shibuya station and 3 from Shibuya Crossing. The rooms were small, but the beds spectacular, and the bathroom also great. Breakfast included. The staff correct, and spoke English. As I surely will come again to Japan, I’ll come here again! Thanks to all the staff, Paulo

I rented a twin room (room 1004) and it was quiet, clean and comfortable. However I am surprised of the many 4 and 5 reviews. The hotel is about the same as an average Best Western or perhaps a below average Holiday Inn. Many areas of the hotel are tired and worn. The carpets are worn and old. The AC is an old system where they set it for heat so the entire hotel is on heat. Your only choice is how much heat....or you can open the window. Yes a 10th floor room has windows that open (swing out). Hot water for shower or bath was no problem. The price of the room was too high.....about the same as the Shinagawa Prince which was much nicer. Being near Shibuya is nice (about a 5 minute walk to metro station). Many places to eat in this area. Shibuya is very busy...and pretty dirty. I asked for a one hour check out extension and was quoted $30. Better hotels such as the Richmond only charge $10. Breakfast is adequate but nothing special. They have two places to eat breakfast and one offers western food (except of course in Japan the eggs are runny). Staff nice but nothing special. This hotel gives the impression that it is an old Japanese business hotel attempting to be a tourist hotel..but misses the mark. Internet is ok...not slow...but not fast. No view from the rooms. Excellent pizza place next door. If the price is much lower I may stay here again. Just to be in this area. More likely I will check out the other nearby hotels first.

There isn't really anything wrong with this hotel. It did the job. Great location and walking distance to a lot. Rooms are small. Shower/bathroom is great and the concierge is incredibly helpful making reservations. The free breakfast is pretty terrible. All in all the rooms being small and dark would deter me from staying here again.

Located very conveniently, 5 mins walk from Shibuya Station, but in a quieter part of Shibuya so I didn't hear any street noise.Staff on the reception desk all spoke English and were very pleasant.I stayed in a single non-smoking room, which while not the biggest in the world (as to be expected in Tokyo) was perfectly acceptable and clean. Bed was very comfortable and a combination of cracking the window or air-con got the temperature how I wanted it. There was free wi-fi.Not much else to say really, I didn't spend a whole lot of time there. Would recommend.

Convenient location, stylish, thoughtful details and attentive staff - we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Shibuya Granbell. We had the Superior Twin with double ceiling height, a balcony with a view (13th floor) and an imaginative light feature in the curtain, plus a huge walk-in power shower and a deep bath tub. Loved the generous supply of classy toiletries and the Nespresso machine. The receptionist recommended a fantastic tiny tempura restaurant round the corner (and actually walked us there!).
