WIFI worked well throughout. Japanese breakfast and the 'French Toast' option delicious. The perfect un-corporate oasis in Tokyo.

I really enjoyed this hotel as it provided us free breakfast. We really enjoyed the japanese breakfast every day even though it was the same dishes! The room itself was enough for 2 of us, we were still able to walk around with 2 big luggages. The room is very stuffy upon entering and the whole air conditioning is central heated so we asked the hotel staff to open up our window which was good. We kept this window opened the whole time we were here for 5 nights even when we were sleeping. The bathroom was spacious however I wish there was a proper shower curtain or door because water kept pooling up on the tiles if you weren't careful. The bed was nice however the pillows were quite flat and soft. There was another pillow which was harder but it was more like a log so I wasn't sure sleeping on it would do my neck any good. The location is very good! We caught the airport limosine bus which dropped us too at Ceruleun hotel which is only 5 mins walk from the hotel. I suggest you book with the bus if you don't want any fussing around at the train station and getting lost at which exit to go and if you wont be activating your JR pass any time soon to use the narita express. I also did youtube how to get from shibuya station to the hotel if you do plan to catch the train to the hotel. The hotel gives you a free hotel logo towel if you dont need room cleaned for 1 day which was good because personally I dont think the rooms needed to be cleaned daily. I really enjoyed staying here, I would probably stay here again because of the good location and delicious japanese breakfast! I dont know why alot of people are complaining, you're in Japan, why not experience an authentic japanese meal rather than eat eggs and bacon lol.

The Shibuya Grandbell hotel has a top location. It´s near the Cerulean tower where the buses from and to the airports (Narita as well as Haneda) will stop and its less than 5 minutes to the shibuya crossing. The room is -like the most rooms in Japan- very small but well equipped. The only bad thing about the room was some molt at the ceiling. For breakfast you can choose between two locations but the breakfast of both is horrible, so better book without breakfast and go to the nearby Coffee shop. All in one i think it was a good choice comparing to other hotels and the location is simply perfect.

This hotel is in a great location and centrally located. The area around the hotel was very safe and only a few minutes walk to Shibuya Crossing which has plenty of shopping and restaurants. This hotel was also a few minutes walk from Shibuya Station, which makes it easy and affordable to explore Tokyo.The hotel staff were all very friendly and professional. Overall the rooms and bathrooms were decently sized for Tokyo, and were of average cleanliness. The hotel itself is cute but in need of some updates in the hotel rooms. I don't recommend eating the breakfast unless you are planning to eat cereal the entire time.

Location is very good. Near restos, shops, the train station and Hachiko. We didn't have a hard time finding it. We just hopped on the Airport Limousine Bus from Haneda going to Cerulean Tower and crossed the bridge. We had a pleasant stay for 7d6n. Room was big for Japan's standards (we got a Superior King Room). Clean and quiet, exactly what we wanted. View is not nice, but it's fine as we're out most of the day. There's free breakfast which you can have in their 2/3 restos. Selection can be improved though, but their staff are just so nice we didn't mind. Will most likely stay here again once we go back to Tokyo.

We were lucky to score an upgrade and were in a room with an amazing bath tub with a view that overlooked the city. Free breakfast was not traditional japanese. I stuck with some scrambled eggs and japanese eggs are amazing so that was quite delicious. All staff was courteous kind and helpful.Location was excellent, near many restaurants and subway connections yet quiet. Only negative was that the upgraded room had a lounge area where smoking is permitted. American's are just heavily sensitive to smoke nowadays and it is always a surprise to be reminded of how common smoking is in japan! The lower lounge area was segmented with a well sealed door so the smoke smell did not permeate into the sleeping area but those with extreme sensitives might want to place a mention with hotel staff to ensure that you are in a truly non smoking room.

Granbell is located in a fantastic location close to the Shibuya Station and walking distance to the district including Shibuya Crossing. The rooms are quite small and do need a little TLC such as new carpets, breakfast is average but reasonable considering the room rate. We liked like the location so will go back when we are in Tokyo again.

My friend and I stayed at this hotel whilst exploring the nearby districts. The hotel is a short walk from Shibuya station which made it a convenient central base. The bathroom had an anti fog patch on the mirror which was handy with two women sharing the room. On both the day of arrival and departure we were able to leave our luggage with the hotel which was convenient for us.

We chose the hotel because we saw the pictures and some reviews and it looked nice. However, the photos are far from reality and our room was not clean at all. The sofa and the carpet had stains everywhere. The heating had to be fixed every night as it was not working properly and the staff was not very friendly. I would not recommend this hotel to stay in Tokyo. The location is good but not worthy.

The good:Spacious (for Tokyo), clean, quiet rooms. Decent bathrooms with showers with good pressure. Excellent location. The front desk was always exceptional and friendly.The bad:The WiFi is WhyBother. On the upper floors it drops out constantly.The ugly:The breakfasts are the worst I've had anywhere. I reflexively spit out my scrambled eggs. And, no, making a smile with ketchup under the eggs doesn't make it all better. The other options were just as bad. Do yourself a favor and just budget in breakfast elsewhere if you stay there. I guarantee you won't eat there twice. By far, the best option was Sakuragaoka Cafe. Great coffee and food.

Felt comfortable from day one. Clean, modern room with very comfortable bed. I stayed for 7 nights and enjoyed it very much. Close to Shibuya station but not on a crazy busy street. Only thing is WiFi in the evenings could get a bit slow, but it didn't bother me too much. Overall I would stay there again.

Great location but felt the hotel needed a bit of love. The carpets in the hall were stained and you could tell it needed some work. The actual room was fine but we had stayed in hotels during the same trip to Tokyo that we felt were better value. It's a perfectly fine hotel for a few nights, the Japanese breakfast was a real hit but we wouldn't rush back.

I stayed at Shinjuku Granbell the day before staying here. The hotel staff spoke pretty good English and the check in process was smooth and hassle-free. The hotel front desk displayed the instruction on how to use Bebot - travel chatbot that I used in Shinjuku Granbell. The hotel staff explained me on how to use Bebot as well even the instruction was displayed on the front desk. After checking in, the hotel staff helped me to send my luggage to my room as I said that I had to go to somewhere else right after completing checkin process. This time, Bebot helped me to look for some good Izakaya nearby which is located at the back street. I was able to locate some shopping places nearby through Bebot and got some good souvenirs for my girlfriend. Nevertheless, I got some horse oils for my mother from the drugstore nearby as well. Really thanks for having Bebot in this hotel too. When I got back to my room, I was impressed by the lightings and the bathroom. Room service menu had a variety of homemade pizzas to choose from as well as a range of light snacks and drinks. I slept well on the comfortable bed that night. The next day, I went to have breakfast at 2nd floor. There were 3 types of breakfast to choose from and I picked Japanese style breakfast. Breakfast waiting time was short. When the crew served the breakfast, he explained all the dishes to me in English before I had it. Great service from crew at the restaurant! Finally, Bebot showed the way of getting to Haneda airport from hotel as I needed to go to airport after checking out. Overall, I had a pleasant experience staying at this hotel. I highly recommend this hotel to everyone who’s coming to Tokyo!

Located just south of Shibuya station, finding Granbell is a little challenging as its not 'in your face'. Having said this, once you know where it is, you realise how perfectly located it is!Granbell is only 5 minutes walk from the famous Shibuya crossing and the 1000's of people that cross it at every change. The staff are attentive and speak good English. I had my JR railpass sent to the hotel and it they had it ready to give to me.So here are the +'ve and the -'ves!+ Great location+ Price point in comparison is reasonable considering the cost of accommodation in Tokyo+ Room and bathroom were decorated well, and were very clean.+ great assortment of amenities+ free wifi- breakfast - they really need help here! Breakfast isn't a big meal in Japan, so don't expect a wide selection of savoury items. Having said this, the Japanese breakfast was good. There's a 'family mart' (like 7-eleven) at the bottom of the street. Just go there an pick yourself up a riceball or 2 and be on your way!All in all, this is an easy hotel to stay in, and I would stay here again if I am fortunate enough to get back to Japan.

This is a nice hotel, in a very good position near Shibuya station. However, rooms are very small: we booked one Modern double room (larger) and one Comfort double. Both are tiny rooms, but the Comfort is so small that you harly have room for 2 suitcases. Breakfast is another negative aspect of this hotel: the first floor breakfast room serves pre-arranged trays with japanese and western food. The japanese is ok but the western is not very good. The second breakfast room (located at the ground floor) has limited selection (they don't serve tea!!!), but at least you're free to choose from a small buffet.

Very well situated. Good prices. Clean. Friendly people. They will help you find anything you may need and they speak quite well English. The only problem is the breakfast which is mediocre (2 choices : one continental which I didn't like at all. one Japanese which was quite good but weird for Europeans, it includes fish). Also, free wifi.

The Granbell Hotel was the perfect location for our stay. It was a short walking distance to Shibuya Station and the surround streets were quiet, despite the current construction works. The room layout was functional and bathroom very clean. The staff are inviting and were very helpful with all of our questions. We also enjoyed the option to decide between traditional Japanese or Western breakfast each morning.

We are family of three, two adults and one young child. We booked a standard room originally but was "upgraded" to premium room because they had it open. The room was very spacey compare to normal hotel of this kind. Not only the bedroom itself, but bathroom were roomy. Location was perfect to walk around the Shibuya station.

I booked a single room for around 120 usd which I think is a great deal given the close to shibuya station of the hotel with ok breakfast My room is facing the shower and toilet room which don't bother me at all as the bed was comfort and the sound proof is good so didn't hear anything at night even my room is next to the lift. The automatic toilet seat is a nice surprise and convenient

The rooms at the hotel are small compared to other countries but are in line with other Japanese hotels. The room has space for one suitcase and one small bag. The bathroom is first class and the beds are really comfortable. Shibuya is a great neighborhood for restaurants and night life. It is also very close to the train station.

Perfect location from my point of view. The area is packed with things to do, very close to the train station that can take you directly to the major hubs in Tokyo. Services are great - friendly staff, helpful and the rooms are quite nice.

We stayed att Granbell Hotel for about a week. The rooms were nice, comfortable beds and nice view. The rug was a bit dirty but it did not bother us. Very quite room, witch was a surprise since the hotel is located in the heart of Shibuya. Nice and helpful staff.The breakfast was however awful. The staff working at breakfast did not seem to care. Every day there were thins that was out, and they did not refill. So we left breakfast still feeling hungry every day. So if you are staying at this hotel, go out and have breakfast somewere else instead.The hotels restaurant did thoe have very nice pizzas at night. Try them!

โรงแรมอยู่ใกล้กับสถานีชิบูย่า มีทั้งรถไฟใต้ดิน และ JR เดินข้ามสะพานลอยเดินตรงเข้าซอยประมาณไม่เกิน 100เมตร เดินไป 5 แยกชิบูย่าประมาณ 150 เมตร ถนนย่อยหน้า รร.ก็มีร้านอาหารเยอะ พนักงานบริการดีมาก ห้องขนาดเล็กตามแบบญี่ปุ่น ภายในห้องพักสะอาดมาก(ชอบมากคะ) อาหารเช้ามี 2 แบบ คือ แบบญี่ปุ่น กับ แบบบุฟเฟ่นานาชาติ แต่อย่าหวังมากคะ อาหารมีแค่ พิซซ่า ไข่คน(ต้องเรียกไข่คนคะเพราะไม่ได้ม้วนมาสวยๆ แบบออมเลตแต่มาแบบเละๆ เลยคะ) ไส้กรอก แฮม ขนมปังประมาณ 4-5 ชนิด และน้ำต่างๆ The hotel located in a great location clost to Shibuya station which had both Subway and JR Rail Way. Only about 100 metres from the station and 150 metres away from Shibuya shopping centre. A lots of small restaurant on the street infrot of the hotel. Very lovely staffs, Room is quite small as usaul Japanese's hotel but very clean. Has 2 kinds of breakfast which are Japanese and International Buffet but don't be high expectation because not many kinds of food just only Pizza, Omelet, Hot dog,Ham and 4-5 type of bread and Beverages.

Located just minutes away from the Shibuya station in a quiet area, surrounded by cafes and restaurants. The rooms are small but perfectly equipped , modern and quiet. Nice surprise, bkfast was included in the price of the room with Hotel.comStaff was helpful and agreed to give us another room as the first one had a smoke smell.Ask for an elevated floor to enjoy the view.

This was the last place we stayed in Japan, and we were at the hotel for a full week. It was actually a bit disappointing after the previous wonderful places we stayed, especially considering it was one of the highly recommend places by Lonely Planet. The hotel was overall good, it just didn't have the extra special quality that we had found everywhere else. It was a decent sized room, but it did not use the space it had very well. There was almost no where to unpack into, as the closet was small, and there were no drawers. It is in a great location, the price was good, and it included breakfast., We tried both breakfast places, and I found the second floor location's Japanese breakfast to be the most stratifying. Everyone was very friendly and accommodating, and it worked well as a home base for our time in Tokyo. I would in no way discourage anyone from staying here, just be prepared for rooms that look kind of boring.

I travelled for business and have previously stayed in Roppongi in a luxury hotel so this is a departure from normal service.The area was super handy for my needs with a young atmosphere. From a business perspective it's nothing to write home about but is ok. Skip the breakfast, it's truly awful. Internet is hit and miss which is not good for business.There are lots of cool bars in the vicinity which makes up for the lack of niceties in the hotel.

It's a nice hotel in the Shibuya area (4 minutes from Shibuya station). There is lots of restaurants in the area!the rooms are very small, but enough. Good quality of sleep.You can get to the hotel using the "Limousine Buses" from Narita or Haneda to the Cerulean Tower Hotel, which is 2 minutes away.free Wi-Fi availableBreakfast is not the best.....but at least is cheapthere is a restaurant in the lobby.....you can eat or drink something if you do not want to get out.

Good location, fine staff but I just can't get over the carpet. Any hotel that is ok with this grossness is not a hotel I can support. Photos attached. This was in the Annex with the darkest hallway ever.

This is our second visit and we stayed for 5 nights. We decided to return because of the location but this will be the last time. We got room 601 and the carpet is filthy and part of the shower tiles are mouldy. It feels like a motel or hostel. In addition, the service at CONA can also be better too. They start closing the buffet at 10.50 when it is supposed to be 11am. Some days there are eggs but they are cold - some days the trays are empty. Only scraps of food left. When you eat food make with warmth and love - one can feel it. We stayed at a similar three star hotel in Yokohama - Hotel Edit and that whole experience is fantastic.

Got the room with 2 twin beds. Enough space between the beds, long desk, small sofa. Real comfortable room. Stuff friendly and helpful. At reception - all speaking English. There is some smell in the corridors, but not in the room itself. The hotel is quite small. Tall, but just a few rooms in each floor.My one problem is the breakfast. After one attempt we decided to completely avoid it.No big problems - dozens of cafes in 5 minutes radius. Location is great. Quiet street, 5 minutes from busiest center. Best to get there from airport is with limo bus.

Rooms very comfortable, nice bathroom and nice main hall. Breakfast included for booking.com clients. Very close to my beloved Hachi-ko statue, very close to the main station. Good to reach, nice and different aisles for each floor u happen to stay

We stayed here for four nights on our arrival in Japan. The location is very easy to get too, just a few minutes walk from Shibuya station but make sure you have a map the first time as some of the streets can be a little confusing (especially at night) if you don't know where you're going. It was nice a quiet for us, too, despite being in what's considered a buzzing district for nightlife. For a business hotel, the rooms are not terribly small. You would struggle a bit for space if you had more than one large suitcase but it's certainly not the smallest room we were in on our trip. The bathroom is positively spacious compared to some business hotels, too. I'm 6'2" and I managed to fit on the bed and the shower head was high enough for me. The included breakfast was quite nice. One of the restaurants, CONA, was closed when we were there so we could only have breakfast at Sakula on the second floor but there were three options there: Japanese style, western style, and french toast. The Japanese breakfast (fish, rice, natto, miso soup, pickles) was plenty of food and good quality. Western was lacking a bit in quantity but seems to be a fairly standard western breakfast in Japan (eggs, salad, toast). The french toast also didn't have much but it was tasty. The restaurant staff didn't speak much English but they know enough to get by. The front desk staff spoke very good English making communication and asking questions easy. It's a little bit on the pricier side but worth the extra money for the convenience of the location and little bit bigger room.

The location was excellent, and the directions provided from the train station were excellent.The room, especially the linens, were very clean. (I'll agree with other reviewers that the carpets could use a clean, but the provided slippers helped negate that.) It was also quiet, with ample outlets.Reception speaks excellent english and they will keep your luggage for after you check out.

Everything's really nice here For me. Tourists mostly asians go here maybe because of Hachiko. This is a great place to stay for me because I can afford the rate and also because the staff treats you fair

We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights.The room was small and clean however the carpets were flithy anb needed a good clean. There were marks and spills all over it. Unfortunately, this distracted from other aspects of the room. Bathroom was larger than normally found in Tokyo hotels and it was very modern with all up to date amenities. The location was very close to Shibuya station and the main shopping area and it was in a relatively quite area. Apart from the carpets, my only other complaint was there was no coin laundry facilities on site. This I feel a necessity if they wish to cater for tourist who do not want to pay exorbitant prices for their laundry services. They did direct us to a coin laundry facility about 2 km away. The staff were okay however a message that was left for me was never delivered to me which was disappointing. I found this quite surprising after staying in many hotels in Japan where staff go out of there way to help you.The breakfast was basic but adequate.Apart from the location which was excellent, I would probably not stay in this hotel again.

Stayed here for the last night of our Honeymoon and I wish we would've had longer to stay! The hotel itself was clean, reception was friendly, courteous and prompt. No problems with communication at all. They have detailed instructions on their website as to how to find the hotel which is very helpful. Note: It might seem complicated but it's actually NOT! It felt like it was steps away from the Shibuya station. It is up a bit of an incline, though. The front door is really cool!Staff upgraded us to the suite as a gift, and it was such a nice surprise. The room itself was a nice size with huge TV, comfy couch and bed. At night we got a surprise - if you look at photos you'll know what it was, but I'd recommend you wait to find out! All the beauty supplies and 'extras' in the bathroom were pretty luxe-level (Shiseido, etc) which I loved. They have a restaurant on site but I can't speak to that as we had other plans. I thought it looked pretty decent for breakfast though (western style)

We stayed in the cozy suite and it was quite roomy and nice and quiet. Spread over 2 floors it had everything we needed. Breakfast is basic but nice. I like this Side of shibuya as an easy walk to naka-meguro and there is heaps to eat near the hotel. You need to climb the crossings to get to the station but that is only about 3 to 5 minutes.

The room was small but I expected that. The bed was very comfortable, airconditioning was great and the shower was awesome. Wifi reception wasn't great in my room.The staff at the desk was very helpful although not all of them speak english very well.Breakfast was ok (small portions on the 2nd floor and tastewise just ok on the 1st floor) but I only used it three times in the week that I was there.I would recommend this hotel for the location alone but as you can see there is plenty to like about it.

We booked the Modern Double Room as we decided to pay that little bit extra to get the larger room. the room was big enough for us to be able to have both suitcases on the ground and still have room to move. the only thing we didn't really like was the very dim lighting in the room and the bathroom.The bathroom was a decent size and the shower was amazing but its a glass case inside the room. There was a curtain that you could pull across for more privacy but still depending on who you travel with it could get quite awkward.We would stay again though. close walk to Shibuya train station.

My adult daughter and I made this hotel our base for 8 nights and we were delighted with our selection. We wanted an option from a large pricey high rise yet needed one in Shibuya. this hotel is 5 minutes to the station but far enough away that there is no street noise whatsoever. It's a hidden gem in fact. From the station one can roll a suitcase as there are elevators up and down for the pedestrian overpass, no sweat! If arriving from Narita, take the airport limousine bus to the Tokyu Cerulean Hotel and walk 3-4 minutes to the Granbell. Honestly this is the easiest way to do it. The hotel emailed me this suggestion by the way. The included breakfast options are either plated Japanese or Western or a smaller western buffet. The plated option offers very small portions so the buffet is best. The buffet/bar area is a little shoddy and honestly I think that management should work on renovating this area or sprucing it up a bit. Front desk staff are polite and helpful but limited in their English language skills. The level of friendliness is modest by western standards but the staff are well informed and can assist you with almost anything you need. There is a coin laundromat not far away and the hotel will give you a map to it. Laundry service is available but pricey. The in room amenities were outstanding, never seen so much stuff provided. Additionally, bathrobes and slippers are commonplace throughout Japanese hotels. Our room was on a higher floor at the end of the corridor and very quiet. The best thing is the location. Shibuya is a very nice hip happening district and only a metro stop away from Shinjuku and Rappongi two other happening places. I highly recommend this property, clean, modern and efficient.

I usually stay around the corner, but this time chose a more budget friendly option to save some money and I am NOT doing this one again. The rooms were small, which is fine, it's Tokyo and tried very hard to be trendy -- bright colored lights, speaker system, and modern furniture. However, the cramped room managed to feel like a prison, my window looked directly into a wall with no light, and the bathroom did not seem like anything I wanted to touch more than I needed to. All of this I could have managed until I got to breakfast, which was included. All I have to say is powdered eggs. There has got to be a better option... with reliable wifi.

The location of the hotel is excellent, still only a short walk from Shibuya station and the hussle and buzzle, but in a relative quiet side street. There are lots of excellent restaurants around. Actually apparently one of the best Yakitori restaurants is just across the street from the hotel.Staff is very friendly and the hotel is very modern. Would definitely go there again!Rooms are small, but this is what you have to expect in Tokyo at those prices. Still fantastic value for money.

The hotel is fine, it is in the tourist area of Shinjuku (kabuchiko). Some of the hotels close by were adult only hotels however we didn’t have any problems with this. The facilities in the hotel are good. The bathroom is very nice and spacious compared to the other bathrooms we have seen in Japan. The double bed is very small and fits two normal people, who should mind sleeping very close to each other. Two big people cannot sleep in this bed. The bed was comfortable. Breakfast is very expensive for what you get. Walking from here to shinjuku station is around 10-15 minutes, not very close by.

Stayed here for 3 nights. I've been to Tokyo many times so expected the teeny-tiny room...it was really teeny-tiny. The bathroom was glass (strange sensation) and quite large with an excellent shower, though. I didn't like the fact that the heating was on which meant that the air conditioning was off. The room was too warm even with the heating switched off, this meant having to keep the window open...which was noisy.Breakfast in the hotel was quite nice. I liked the waiter service restaurant rather than the buffet as there was no room to swing a cat in there. The food in the waiter service place was very tasty, but the portions were, like my room, teeny-tiny.The staff were always friendly and helpful.Location wise, it's right next to the south exit of JR Shibuya Station. Getting to the hotel means crossing a massive junction with an overhead pedestrian walkway via steps (there is a lift tucked away behind the first staircase). Not for me, I just didn't like staying in Shibuya. I much prefer Tokyo Station an Nihonbashi areas.

Staying at the Shibuya Granbell. We love the location. For us it is the perfect location, with only minutes away from the excitement of the Shibuya Crossing, and minutes to get back to some quiet time. The service is wonderful, with everyone so attentive and polite. We are loving it here. The rooms are small, but have everything we need. Supplies are topped daily. Whilst there was a limited breakfast menu, it was still perfect. The people are what make this place so special. The showers are the most amazing showers, nice hot water and amazing water pressure. We have not stayed anywhere else, but we have been happy with selecting the Granbell.

First of all, location wise is just average. This hotel is located at the opposite side of all the action happening in Shibuya. You have to cross an overhead bridge to get to the other side where all the shopping and restaurants are. The hotel is also located in the middle of an upslope. You can take the airport limousine or train to the airport but either way, you are not going to have an easy time dragging the luggages to Cerulean Sky Hotel or Shibuya Station. Secondly, the single room that I stayed in was extremely small and the arrangement of the furniture was not fully maximizing space in the room. There was no wardrobe and absolutely no space to use the laundry drying rack even though there was one in the room. I had to move the furnitures around to make space for my luggage and walking space. Power sockets were located at weird places too. There was no air-con until the very last night of my stay. Survived with only the pathetic portable air-con in the room.Lastly, the wifi really annoyed the hell out of me. All my devices got disconnected every few minutes. Tried to speak to the staff about it and their response was that they will try to restart the router. Same thing happened again and again and again. Gave up on using the so-called free wifi after awhile. Wifi is a basic amenity provided by hotels everywhere nowadays, please look into this.If you are thinking of booking the single room, I would suggest you look elsewhere. There should be better hotels out there within the same price range.

Very happy with my stay here for 2 weeks. I enjoyed it so much that my parents will be staying here when they go to Japan later this year. I highly reccomend this be your first choice when looking for accomodation in Tokyo - from Aussie traveler.

I frequently stay in shibuya but this is the first time at this hotel. While any hotel in shibuya demands a premium price, this hotel is pricing itself in the wrong category. It is a 3 star hotel charging 4 star prices, and has a bit of an amateur vibe about it. Cheap feeling, dimly lit rooms that were decorated using 1980s fixtures, only one power outlet located as far away from the bed as possible, and curtains that don't block out the light. Turning the lights off is a test of logic and patience as they have hidden various light switches all around the place. The hotel is also a bit far from the station as to be a little annoying, and is on the opposite side of where you actually want to be when you visit shibuya. Just stay at the Excel Shibuya hotel. If you must stay here (like I did, because it was the only choice) perhaps ensure you aren't staying in the area they lovingly call "the annex", which I believe to be code for "the old rooms we don't photograph so people don't think we have such rooms when they visit our website".

The hotel's location is near hachiko and the station. The rooms are small so we paid extra for an upgrade to a bigger room. Small selection for the breakfast. Everything was ok until check out, we thought check out was 12:00 pm and front desk was charging us extra for the extension. Other hotels are happy to give late check out. Small things like this is what will make customers come back to the hotel. So travellers beware! They do not give any considerations at all. I would say, this will be my first and last stay in this hotel. For the money we paid, we should have gone to Cerulean instead - better service.

I loved the location of this hotel! It's super close to the JR line and Shibuya station. There's a lot of restaurants and a family mart close by! Yes, the hotel is a little worn (especially the elevator) but our room was very clean and comfortable!! As a couple, stayed in a modern double for five nights, it had a good amount of space. I slept comfortably in this room and the shower worked well (our room had one of those rain showers). There's an empty fridge in the room where you're able to store drinks and snacks. Also, they give you two bottles of water when they clean the room. The breakfast buffet was simple but I enjoyed getting coffee there! This is a very affordable hotel in one of the best locations!

The Granbell Hotel in Shibuya was ideal for our 2 night stay. It was about a 10min walk from Shibuya station. There are lots of little side streets in the area so we needed google maps to find it but that was easy enough. We arrived at lunch time so were too early to check in (check in time is 15:00). The hotel were happy to store our luggage so we left it in the reception area. The reception staff spoke good english and helped us book a restaurant for our first night.The room is small but we knew to expect this in Tokyo. It was clean, and well equipped with toiletries, hair dryer etc and there was free wifi. Despite being in the Shibuya area the hotel was quiet so we got a great nights sleep. I would definitely stay again!

The hotel is 5 minutes walk from Shibuya metro station,the room compare to Japan was quite big and modern. The stuff was able to speak in English and very helpful. The location was just great! close to the famous Shibuya crossing and all the shops and famous brands. The price was totally worth it!

I went to Japan on a last second trip for my company and decided to give a Japanese hotel company a try. Being accustomed to American branded Hilton hotels this hotel was a little small however, it was WONDERFUL! I totally understand the limitations and this room made the most of what space it had. I wasn't exactly sure about the large L shaped tub as it seemed it could take maybe an hour to fill up however it the shower was wonderful. The bed was a double and very comfy. Will definitely stay here again. Next time I'm in shibuya

3 nights here was a great base for exploring the city. 5 min walk to the crazy Shibuya crossing and station, means that most of wild Tokyo is easily accessible. Room is very small, but comfortable and has all the needed amenities for a good stay. Bathroom little larger than comparable hotels we stayed in which was a welcome change.Air Conditioning was a bit of a drama, as it was set at hot the entire time. We had to get the reception staff open the window for us, which then has issues of noise, but to be honest this was a minor issue. Breakfast was included and offer two options in 2 restaurants. Found the buffet on the ground floor was better for us, rather than the set meal on the first floor, but i imagine it depends on what you are looking for. Overall this is a very reasonably priced hotel for what it offers. Clean, compact and comfortable it is a no frills bed to collapse in after a long day in Tokyo.

This hotel is the perfect hotel to stay in if you're in your late teens / early 20s and are just looking for a bed for the night close to all of the party action.The rooms are absolutely tiny - and there was no space to open my 24" suitcase, or to hang any clothes. The room was poorly designed with a desk that is way too big for the room and encroaching on invaluable floor space. The room felt slightly worn, with lamp fittings appearing to be pulling away from the wall, and the odd picture on the wall (a random shot of an indoor climbing wall) seemed like a laminated photocopy mounted onto the wall (it too was peeling away).The two stars that I am giving this hotel are for:1 - The Staff2 - The Japanese breakfastYou may say that you get what you pay for (and this was the cheapest room night of my stay at $120 including breakfast), but in terms of value for money for a few dollars more you can get so much more.As for the area (Shibuya), it's the Times Square of Japan. I stayed in Roppongi, Shinjuku and Hibbiya ... Shibuya was definitely my least favourite.
user_name:
JMO73
New York City, New York

review_body: Very good location of the hotel.Staff speaks English at average level, however it's good enough to understand what, where, how.Room was super small. I did expected this in Tokyo, so no surprise.Bathroom and toilet very big in comparison to the room size.Safe, minibar, TV. Window faces a wall.Depends what the purpose of the trip. Overall good impressions.

Yes the rooms are compact. The only place I could open my suitcase out was on the floor or bed. But considering the position and price, what do you want?Breakfast was ok, it's fuel.Staff are friendly and speak enough English.To get to Shibuya Intersection that you will no doubt visit a lot you have to cross an overpass. If you have trouble with stairs or carting much luggage there are lifts each side so don't worry.

After reading so many reviews for all hotels in Japan, I expected a tiny room and bed, but this was much better than I expected! Great room, decent size bed and bathroom, loved the complimentary breakfast included daily that we weren't expecting! Great location, friendly staff who all spoke pretty decent English. Would definitely stay here again and recommend it to people wanting to stay in shibuya area.

The room is tiny. I can't even open my suitcase it's that small. The wifi is awful and you can't even loads internet pages. There's no European or US or USB plug sockets. If you are taller than 5"3 then you won't fit in the bed. The rooms are old and dated. The carpet is dirty and so are my covers.

Lovely place, great spot and funky rooms. This is my second stay here. It's so conveniently located in Shibuya, just outside all of the bustle, but amazingly close to everything you need. Friendly staff and cool rooms make this a great choice.

Room was decent size, room was clean, good shower after a long day out, friendly and helpful receptionists, great location at a decent room rate ! Definately will go back. Surprise... the entrance was very unique

I was in Tokyo Jan 2017 for 8 nights, I stayed in Shinjuku 4 nights and Shibuya 4 nightsTwo location are perfect to anywhere. Granbell is a boutique hotel,very stylish and morden. Very close to the train station. the one in Shinjuku is mainly group check inbut here is more relaxing all staff are friendly and helpful as well, if your plan is longer than one week, I suggest you try at least 2 difference hotel, you will see more in difference locationconsider to try both....

Very close to train station on multiple lines - so can get virtually anywhere in Tokyo. Hotel was average to good - staff were friendly, but didn't go out of their way, rooms were very small with no storage (would have preferred smaller bed) to leave space for at least suitcases, and breakfast at either option was ok but not great.Would probably price check other options prior to booking here. Shibuya location, however, is perfect.

Not a pleasant stay.The staff was accommodating at check-in/out, but all the balance was substandard.Parking was a headache.Rooms are small (even for Japan).Lame breakfast.Close to station but in a dark area.Even for one night, there are better options around.

Hotel is a bit tired but comfortable to stay.Compared to the Shinjuku one the Shinjuku ones is a lot better in terms of newness, vending machine variety and it also has a washing machine which is handy.Rooms at shibuya hotel could do with up grade.Location is great as it is close to everything you could need. It is quiet too.

Room was above average to Japanese hotel standard. Minimal to none in breakfast menu choices. As tourists we wanted to stay somewhere convenient. IT says it is near the JR station. Yes it is true, BUT it didnt say that you have to take an wide overpass everytime you want to cross the street. No other way to reach the other end which is the shibuya crossing without taking the overpass. And it is an uphill road towards the hotel, so good luck with the luggages.

two things are disappointing, first the floor carpet at the room is nasty, second, if you dont speak japanese, they dont have too many tv channels and no one is in english, the staff is friendly, the breakfast at first floor is poor, i didn't try the 3rd floor, maybe is better

The location was excellent for us as first-timers to Tokyo. It was just a short 5-10 min walk to the Shibuya crossing and had great restaurants and bars in the streets around the hotel. The hotel itself was quirky and cute in its design and is a good boutique hotel...clean and modern. For two of us, the room was a bit small considering we had two large suitcases, but otherwise we were really happy with this hotel. Breakfast was great - there were lots of options (western breakfasts, "french" breakfast which was french toast, and a Japanese breakfast). I opted for the Japanese breakfasts for both mornings and really loved it.

Breakfast is pretty delicious. There are some problems with the kettle and the heater at first, but the staff helped us with care (we are really touched). The location is pretty good. 7 minutes then it's Shibuya Station, and 10 to 15 minutes will be the shopping centers. We are really touched by the service and we are really satisfied :)

This was the second time I stayed at Shibuya Granbell (2 years after my first visit). The rooms are small but not as small as some of the rooms I have stayed in throughout Japan. The hotel is modern and very clean, they are accommodating with requests to leave bags before and after check in/check out. The location is amazing.. just a short walk to Shibuya crossing and train station! Check in staff are lovely, cleaning staff are courteous and always smiling, the man who works in the upper level restaurant is amazing and so friendly!! There is one negative this time around and it was the restaurant on the bottom level, normally a Italian style restaurant but serving an extremely mediocre western style buffet breakfast for hotel guests in the morning. It appears that the staff do not care about or even want the hotel guests in their restaurant.... the buffet is sloppy and badly presented and the staff are so rude, unwelcoming and act like you are a bother rather than a guest!! I would recommend the hotel cut ties with them as it is not a good look to be associated with.

we would like to give our sincere thanks to shibuya grandbell hotel for the suite upgrade. the suite was excellent for our own time. we really enjoyed the space, the bath tub, the ambience and quality of room.

Stayed in this hotel for 8 days and was given one of their suite which was big by Tokyo standards. The suite was pleasant and clean but other members of my family stayed in a small and cramped room on the lower floors, better lighting would've made it more desirable. I liked that the location was just minutes from the Shibuya subway and the famous Shibuya crossing...very conveniently located with shops,restaurants,cafes aplenty & all just minutes away. The breakfast on the 2nd floor was way better than the one on the 1st floor (yes they've got 2 breakfast places), at least the service was better on level 2. Other than that, the hotel is rather costly for what it's worth in my opinion.

We were upgraded to the suite since it was our honeymoon (it was greatly appreciated!!) - it was a smoking room so the scent was unpleasant however the suite was beautiful and the spaciousness was definitely a plus especially in a place like Tokyo! The staff were professional and well mannered. The complimentary breakfast was meh - would probably recommend saving your stomach space for good Japanese food instead.

I had a wonderful 3 night stay in this hotel! The staff was helpful and friendly, as they also accommodated to all our requests. They helped us call a taxi for an early morning flight and also gave us extra bottles of the green tea shampoo as a gift just because my mom mentioned she loved it and was wondering if it was sold elsewhere. The room looked exactly the same as the pictures and was nice and clean. No complaints. The hotel itself has a modern and minimalistic design. I especially love the design of the entrance doors! The location is also great since it was a five minute walk to the frenzy of Shibuya crossing and center gai while still feeling quaint and tucked away from when you wanted to get away from said frenzy. The hotel itself is also on a block that is filled with different restaurants so the choices near by are vast.All in all, I would definitely stay here again.

We stayed at the Granbell overnight and didn't really enjoy it. While located next to the main station, it is quite challenging to find if you have never been to this place before. The staffs were not very friendly (both during check-in and check-out) and did not speak good English. The room was very small, but clean. Despite that, I did enjoy the traditional japanese breakfast.

Stayed in the Artistic Single Room with the clear view into the bathroom and absolutely loved it! Staff were accomodating and nice although sometimes the language barrier made it difficult to communicate (but that it expected in Japan). I recommend catching a bus from the airport to Cerulean then walking to Granbell (there's still a small hill but it saves you from walking up and down the stairs if you were to catch the train). Very close to the crossing (5 minute walk) and also close to convenient stores (Lawson and 7-11) and restaurants. The room itself is clean and big enough for a single traveller like myself.

I stayed at the Granbell for a week. The room was clean and large for Tokyo. I had a problem at check in which was odd and nobody ever cleared up the issue for me. Also the included breakfast could be better. The restaurants are a bit broken down. All in all it was ok. Would I stay there again? Maybe. Not sure

We were warned in the reviews about the size of the room. We got a deluxe room, with a larger bed. The bed was very comfortable. The room was extremely clean. We liked the breakfast. We used the dry-cleaning at the hotel, and were completely satisfied. The staff was very nice. The pizza place adjoined to the hotel was nice. We ate there our first night when we were so jet-lagged. There are several restaurants close by that are also good. It was extremely easy to walk to the Shibuya station. We followed the directions on the hotel website, and we able to find the hotel easily. We liked the location. We would stay there again.

Recently stayed here in a premium double room the room was quite large and spacious very clean and comfy bed. Breakfast was included very basic but still breakfast and coffee.The hotel is within walking distance to Shibuya crossing, shops restraunts and stations. Would stay here again and recommend to family and friends.

Stayed for 3 nights in one of the premium rooms on the 13th floor. I really loved this place. Staff were great, very helpful, friendly and professional, organised reservations and taxis etc. We felt very safe and comfortable. Room was spacious for Tokyo with a balcony and high ceiling. The little pizza and wine restaurant on site was good too. We choose the location because we were attending an event nearby, but being less than 2 mins walk from Shibuya station and just a short walk from Shibuya crossing was very convenient, but we still felt like we were tucked away in a cute little street on a hill. I loved the vibe. Highly recommend.

From the Shinjuku train station you have a little adventure to find the hotel, but it's not all that hard if you google map street view it in advance. The entrance is a little difficult to identify, but is doable. My room was tiny for sure, they are very strategic about the layout, including a raised bathroom area that is all glass so that you don't feel how small the room actually is. The glass walls to the bathroom do have a shower curtain, so you can gain privacy if you need. The walkway is barely wide enough for the suitcase that is carry-on approved sizing - and i literally mean like with an inch on either side of wheeling it down the walkway. I didn't have anywhere to lay it out, nor anywhere to put anything that was in the suitcase, so I was really glad I was only there for 1 night. It's the smallest of the 3 rooms that I stayed at in Tokyo. The location is great, there are loads of things SO close to the hotel, I was there purely for jumping off the plane and into Tokyo. The staff was very nice and did speak english just fine. Semi-double bed seems to mean something that is MAYBE a full size American bed, maybe a bit smaller.

The hotel is very close to Shibuya station, which makes it really easy to travel with subway, Narita Express, and JR. It's also near many shopping venues. So when it gets dark in Tokyo and other tourist attractions are closed, you will have a number of great restaurants and shopping malls to visit. The room size is the smallest I have ever stayed in, but I believe this is considered normal for the centre of the world's largest city.

Only a 2 minute walk from Shibuya station, and 5 min. walk from . Stayed here for 5 nights in the end of October.We had a very small room like similar hotels in Japan, but it was clean and actually we had what we needed.Breakfast is poor. Staff are nice and speak English.I would recommend this hotel.

First, the location is great. Quiet, but 5 min. To shibuya crossing and station. Good for starting adventures in tokio.But, the hotel probsbly had its better, design and style days. Today it is pretty run down. The small rooms (okey for japan) are just okey regarding cleanliness, the rest of the hotel is in miserable condition. Also the breakfast ist bad, really plan on going somewhere else to start the day!Staff is very unmotivated and in bad mood (exepct reception and room cleaning) a totally not japan like experience.So all-in-all i have to rate the hotel with only two stars. I have no problems with "older" or even "pretty dirty" hotels but not for a 4-star price. Look if you can find other options close to the location.(And.... Just next door, to the right when leaving hotel, there us a super cool, good, friendly custom made noodle shop. Go there if you are in shibuya - good for lunch and also quick dinner...)

Good location, only a 2 minute walk from Shibuya station (go over the overpass and up one street).Breakfast at either of the hotel options are fairly mediocre, but rooms are quiet and clean No issues with service or price.

Stayed here 3 nights in end of October. Our room on the very top floor as expected is small ... even had trouble finding a space for our large suit case. The layout is kind of weird with a sofa and table separating 2 huge comfortable beds . Its certainly tight , but we managed to moved around . One the plus side, the shower/tub area is spacious and its really clean . The room is a smoking room and surprisingly it was not smelly at all.  Location is good , 5 -10 minutes walk up the pedestrian bridge to Shibuya station and shopping malls. It was tough on the day of arrival dragging our huge suitcase from the station to the hotel though..... but other than that it was definately a convenient location. Breakfast was ok and the staffs are friendly and helpful. Overall it was a good experience .

We stayed at the Granbell for 1 night. I booked a standard style room but did mention in the notes section upon booking that it was our honeymoon. They picked up on this at the front desk during check in and straight away upgraded us to a premier suite! They also left a bottle of wine in the room with a little congratulatory note. It was the only time during our 3 weeks travelling round Japan that this happened! The suite was absolutely incredible, so clean and luxurious. It had brilliant views over Shibuya. We were very grateful for the upgrade, never expected it and I still paid the price I was quoted on booking. The only thing that let the hotel down was the breakfast which was awful! Terrible selection of food (we opted for the buffet style, the set meal in the separate restaurant may be better). The service at breakfast was terrible as well, the only grumpy bad mannered person we came across in 3 weeks!

Stayed for 4 days in October. Hotel and room was clean. I was upgraded to a larger room, but still small. No issue with this as it is expected in Tokyo. Location is great, very close to restaurants, bars and Shibuya Station (less than 5 min walk). Staff was friendly and breakfast was delicious. Didn't like having to pay cover charge for hotel bar at night when I was stopping in for a beer after being out for the evening. Overall, good experience. I would stay here again.

It's too common to have a 8x8 room that literally has just enough space for a bed and toilet and without windows, but I was pleasantly surprised at the size of the rooms here. It was still tight, but there was a little window so it did not feel so claustrophobic. The location is right next to the heart of Shibuya and the staff was friendly and helpful. Wifi worked perfectly, bed was comfortable and water pressure in shower was good so all in all, a recommended hotel.

Cute hotel with great service. Small rooms with quality: nice bedding, toiletries and rather large bathroom with awesome shower! Access to popular shops in Shibuya within walking distance. Also free yummy breakfast!

I have just spent a week at Granbell Shibuya, and couldn't have been more satisfied. It is so close to Shibuya station, but set back a little from the crowds. The room we had was on the third floor, and was very clean, and extremely quiet. It had a huge double bed and a large bath. The room was compact but very comfortable. There was a choice of breakfast each morning, Western or Japanese, and while not large servings, it was complimentary, so 'thank you'!I wouldn't hesitate in recommending this hotel, and would certainly stay here again.

Truly, I can't think why people have reviewed this hotel so favourably. Paying over 250 USD a day to stay in a little section of corridor designed by someone with all the aesthetic sense of boarding school matron is something that most people would surely baulk at. Call me a skinflint alcoholic but be warned - if you decide that, given that you are are not willing to pay the 12USD cover charge to have a drink at the bar of the hotel of which you are a resident you would like a drink from your mini-bar, you will find it completely empty. Are these things related, or are they just consistent expressions of the soul of this hotel? On the plus side, it is conveniently situated and clean.

The room was extremely small looking straight onto a brick wall .. a Premier room?? Requested a move to another room which was equally as bad. Service from reception was average at best, with very little interest in customer service. Good location for Shibuya crossing area. Would not recommend.

Hotel was as expected. Rooms were clean and not too small. Nothing outstanding considering the price, but definitely a decent option given how expensive everything is in Tokyo. Loved the location. Breakfast was great and had a choice of western or Japanese set. Very close to Shibuya train station. The second night of our stay we had to stay in a smoking room, and surprisingly, we couldn't even tell the difference.

We Stayed in Twin Room, and the room is spacious, can't conmect to wi-fi...just the Bathroom is dirty.. The bathroom tiles/grout have some pink mold everywhere. Free breakfast was okay thou (Japanese Style Breakfast)

The bears room we got was very big & comfortable, staff very friendly. It has great location 2 min walk from Shibuya station. The bathroom was one of the best we had... Breakfast in the dining room can be improved, but eating in the bar 1'st floor was good option (or skip breakfast included).Good value for money!!

Best location ever - right near shibuya but on the quite side. SO many cute little eateries around that were amazing. Directly across downstairs there is a sushi joint that has 800 yen lunch menus - amazing and top notch quality even compared to all the other sushi eaten in japan - little izakaya place a few blocks away - てやん亭゛- and an awesome kobe beef place as well around the corner. small rooms, but clever designs - toilets had everything you needed. upgrade if necessary or if 2 people i would recommend. breakfast was decent as well and all you needed in the morning

First time in Tokyo with my family and decided to stay at a better hotel, near to Shinjuku Train Station area. Saw pictures of the rooms and looked spacious and classy. Upon reaching, room was clean but very small with not much space to open my luggage. Tv had no English channels except CNN and I was going to watch movies on my laptop only to find that the wifi was INCREDIBLY SLOW and erratic. I wasn't able to watch my show at all. This happened the next day as well. Zero entertainment in room. The front office staff however were very courteous and helpful. They'd provided me with very clear directions and maps to nearby stations and explained in good English how far it would be. Pictures of this hotel can be very misleading on their website and booking via hotels.com website. It may be the expensive suite pictures you're looking at.

This is a super cool boutique, no kids, no business travelers thank god, is very stylish without being over the top, simple clean and the best location ever, the staff is super friendly bilingual, Roomservice, no fuss, if you coming to Tokyo for shopping, wonder about, experience the food without been stuck in one of those monsters towers with loads of tourist this is the place to stay, decent rooms nice bathrooms, cute little terrace bar where you can watch the world go by, I highly recommended

I had a single room so it was small as expected for most rooms in Japan. The price was good especially for the location (very near the Shibuya scramble) and close to the JR Shibuya station. Rooms had a modern look, no view from my room.

I usually stay at the Excel in Shibuya but this time I was put up in the Granbell Hotel .. out the back end of Shibuya station. Again not too far a walk from the main Shibuya Crossing. Cool little hotel. Modern. The price was not too bad at the time - but that was (I think) down to the relationship my clients had with the hotel itself (apparently it has raised its prices somewhat since then making it not necessarily the bargain hotel it was before). Lots of arty and music folk stayed here in the time I was here. A short hop and a skip and a jump from The Ro - a tiny soulful/funky/jazzy bar/club owned by the Kyoto Jazz Massive crew. Naturally loads of bars and restaurants in the neighbourhood.

Visiting Japan for the first time, my wife and I enjoyed 4 nights at Granbell. Our room & bathroom were clean, love the toilet bidet seat cover. Room was small which is common in Japan but comfortable. It was so convenient to Shibuya shopping centre & JR station. Restaurants nearby were good. Their website's instruction on how to get to hotel from Shibuya Station was spot on. On utube the video on same was excellent. The free breakfast was okay, but we eat more often at the restaurant above.Staff don't speak much English, but we got by. Disappointed that no English speaking TV channels were available.

I was really impressed by the service and the location. Good price and breakfast.The staff are extremely professional and friendly. They speak English and will help with everything, like reserving restaurants and giving direction for sight and shopping. Room are a bit small but standard for tokyo. The toilet and shower was very clean at all time. The price, including a choice in between buffet, Western or Japanese breakfast was just right. At about 5 minute walk to shibuya station, you have access to one of the best transportation hub in tokyo. Also, being in shibuya, you have many amazing restaurants and foodshow in the shibuya station lower level. Many store to shop at (109, adidas store, beams and many more), shibuya crossing, hikari shopping center and many more. I did 90% of my shopping in that area. Despite being close to this location, the Granbell is in a calm street and very relax. I will definitely go back on my next trip to tokyo.

We have stayed at the Cerulean up the street and it is more modern and more upscale. We tried this place because of the good reviews. Pro: -close to the action-Close to the train station-We had a problem with our room and received excellent customer service from staff member Remi S. at the front desk and the issue was rectified in minutes. Con: The premier double room we booked is large by European standards and small by North American standards.The hotel is ten years old and is showing its age in worn carpets and paint etc.

Pretty love this hotel as it gives me access to the vibrancy of Shibuya crossing and all - but also the rest and peace I longed for every each day's events, to be away from the action for a good night sleep.Crossing from Shibuya station to the hotel requires you to move up this huge bridge - however, there's an elevator connected to the bridge - hence it was a Breeze moving up and across with even my huge luggage. Eateries such as sukiya beef bowl and others are easily accessible right outside the hotel. Some of them open till late - hence anytime u require supper, just walk out. Quite a pleasant and compact room for a short stay. Reception was pleasant and complimentary breakfast was provided too. Enjoy your stay!

We are a contemporary couple who like to stay at mid priced boutique hotels.We are not the four season customer.I establish our profile because I don't understand the good reviews for this hotel.The photos on the internet show it to be a hip looking contemporary place to stay.Maybe in its hay day, but our experience was that it is run down and needs better management.Maybe it was just our room that was bad.It smelled like smoke/ nursing home. The walls are dirty,the carpet in our room and elevater are stained,and the staff was mediocre .There is a sitting area and and bar off to the side of the lobby.Now the bar is defunct and behind the bar is storage,old T.Vs etc. covered with a blanket..The only good things I could say about this hotel are 1) We were hardly in it. 2)The bathroom was top notch. 3) It is extremely close to the train station.The Cerulean Tower Tokyo Hotel is just a short half a block further from the train station.We entered this hotel on the day we were leaving to pick up the limousine shuttle back to the airport.With out having seen the rooms I would recommend this place instead.Everything about it was big,bright, shinny,clean,and refreshing looking compared to the Grandbell. In the short time I was there I could see that the staff was brighter and more refreshing too.

Quite good location, a 5 minute walk away from Shibuya station. The rooms are clean, comfortable and modern. Japanese or western breakfast sets to chose from. Check-in procedures were efficient and polite (as is the case normally in Japan).

Great Hotel, friendly staff, top english speaking, room has everthing you need, very clean,super bathroom, comfy bed, top recommendation, great value for money, our first visit in Tokyo so we can't compare to other hotels but we will stay here for sure next time again, 2min walk from shibuya station

This is a really neat hotel in the heart of shibuya. Easy access to and from the station and plenty of dining options nearby. It has raised its prices considerably since we first stayed the year before, so it's no longer great value, however the area is really a positive reason for using this place as a base for Tokyo exploring.

This hotel is very well located in a small street near Shibuya square. Hence it is very calm. However, before arriving, make sure you have a good room. Mine had a really small window, and the view was ... A wall ... Ok, you don't stay in Tokyo to stay all day long in your bedroom but still, it would be nice to warn people. And when I tried to change my room, they said it was impossible ... I stayed there for a whole week. Really impossible ? The room was clean, but still had some doubts about the carpet ...

Hotel is across the pedestrian crossing outside the Shibuya train station. We booked a double + single room, check in was very efficient. Both rooms are tiny but very nice and clean. Your are provided breakfast at 2 of their locals. Both I wouldn't rave about at all but yet again can't complain given the price, so if you're on a budget, enjoy it. So many great places to eat and drink nearby all within walking distance.

We have reserved this hotel as it was located in between of all our planned tours. The hotel is a bit hidden but once out of Shibuya station you just need to cross the pedestrian bridge and you are almost there... The hotel as lots of restaurants around and a 24/7 supermarket. Also in Shuibuya station you can find lots of stores. The room we reserved as the cheapest available but still was super expensive.. it had breakfast included but still... The room was ok, modern, with a view for a parking lot, but with lots of light.They have two types of breakfast, the european that was really really limited, just some scrambled eggs, some sausages, some salads, bread, milk, coffee and juice... And the japanese, that is ok, but still nothing spectacular. For the prices paid, the breakfast should have been perfect, what was not. When we reserved we informed we were celebrating a special day and they did nothing special, no detail in the room, absolutely nothing... First night we were scared with a earthquake that moved all the hotel but I think this is kind of normal there...The overview for this hotel experience is good enough to recommend it but they need to have more attention to details and also improve the breakfast served.

Rooms are on the smaller side but the location and service absolutely make up for it. This hotel is close to Shibuya Crossing but far enough so that it's quiet in the evening. Would definitely stay here again!

Shibuya Granbell is very conveniently located close to Shibuya station with access to many lines. It is also a short walk to Shibuya Crossing. Breakfast is provided in two rooms. One offers eggs toast croissants and the other set menu including Japanese breakfast. The wi fi was very reliable. I would recommend a stay here.

Located within walking distance to the Shibuya station & with many food options nearby. Staff were eager to help. Room was small but clean. Breakfast was very good with the option of Japanese & Western food. Both very good but I have to mention the scramble eggs. Personally not a big fan of scramble eggs but they won me over. Sausages was also of very good quality.

Checked out this morning at 7.45am , 9th July at Granbell Tokyo , Shibuya. Horrific experience at the reception lobby. As I had a few heavy luggage which was tough to managed on my own I had asked for help from a gentlemen in grey stripe suit on duty at the reception. He simply walked over to a corner where a few luggages we faced and pointed to a trolley and said you can use this and then walked away.I then struggled to maneuver the "bell boy" trolley up to the 5th floor through the dark narrow corridor and tiny small lift. Worst was finally when I got down with my luggages at the lift lobby and it was raining heavily I had to pushed the trolley out myself with no help offered to put the bags into the taxi I booked. The same angry face reception service staff spoke over from his counter said please return my trolley. What an experience.Hope the hotel do something to improve their service.

For visiting Tokyo, I think this hotel is the best. We liked the fact that it is small( we went to some big luxurious American style hotel and hated it, not to mention it was double the price). The hotel has a perfect placement and the staff is amazing (like anywhere in Japan) The food was also amazing considering we always took the Japanese breakfast option which was the fish of the day and a bowl of rice with some other accompaniment depending on the season. I absolutely loved my stay in Tokyo and this hotel made it perfect.

Very good hotel placed at shibuya, close to metro and also near to some good restaurants... Very clean and the service also very good. On my next time in Tokyo I will for sure stay at this hotel. Staff very kind and always want to help you.

Yes, the rooms are small. Tiny, It's Tokyo. Once you settle in you'll realize this is all you need perfectly located in the heart of Shibuya. Very clean and comfortable bed, fantastic housekeeping staff, terrific toiletries, very good breakfast, excellent coffee. Wifi was reliable. Windows open for fresh air. Spent a week here in April at a very reasonable rate. Booking far in advance saved about 50%. It was very hard to find from Shibuya Station (the first time) but once you figure it out there are landmarks everywhere to easily lead you back to the hotel Wish I could give some advice to make it easier the first time around. I spent over an hour wandering around lost with my luggage. Maybe it's just me.

Standard small Japanese room. However, since you're ever only there to shower and sleep, it was perfect. The free Japanese breakfast in the morning was the ideal way to start a day in Japan. Location was easy to find. Near restaurants, shopping, and the train station. Definitely not a luxury hotel, but who needs luxury when traveling the world and experiencing different cultures!

Nice hotel. Clean and comfortable. A bit trendy but quieter and the employees are very nice. We stayed for one night before leaving Japan. It was nice to be close to shibuya but outside of the main craziness. The hotel is very quiet and quite comfortable. We stayed at granbell shunjuku when we first arrived and this one is similarly nice but a but more convenient to the train.

We stayed in the hotel for 6 nights. The bottom line is that we are happy with our selection of the hotel, mainly due to its great location which is 5 minutes from Shibuya station, from the scramble crossing and the pedestrian area. Our room was tiny, almost no place to move around or to place the language. Breakfast is very minimal. The hotel's corridors are dark and so is the light in the room, very minimal light.The service in the reception is a good one. Once you approach them and ask a question, you will get polite and comprehensive answers. Other than that, you can come in and out and no one will pay attention to you. This is very different than the warm and attentive attitude experienced all over Japan.We will surely stay in this hotel again in the future due to its location, not from any other reason.

Location: The location is perfect - a 5 minute walk from Shibuya station. (Shibuya station itself is a maze of exits so we did get lost on our arrival so I cannot thank the friendly policemen stationed at the station for pointing us in the right direction!) There are very handy directions on Granbell's website which directs you using the landmarks.Room: We stayed in the Penthouse Suite, which is a lovely room with a balcony (which I enjoyed sitting out on late at night watching the hubbub of the city). The bathroom is a fantastic space with a large bath and rainfall shower. The bed was really comfortable, the only niggle being you couldn't comfortably sit up due to the handle decoration on the headboard. Plenty of plug sockets to charge what we needed. Large TV too, only Japanese channels shown (although we weren't there to watch the telly so it didn't bother me!). Complimentary bottled water was a nice touch and very handy to take with us when out for the day. Free wifi was reliable and had a strong signal.Breakfast: The two onsite resturants give you two options for breakfast - Saka La Dining which serves a set menu and CONA which offered a continental buffet style breakfast. I preferred the offering at CONA as I enjoyed watching the chef preparing pizza bases for the rest of the day. There wasn't much choice in the buffet, but there was enough to keep you going until lunch time.Other comments: On arrival we were told that because we hadn't replied to the email they had sent that morning, we were in danger of losing our reservation. its a little had to respond to a email when you've been travelling on planes for the past day and a bit! it was a moment of stress that we could have done without. I think this may be a cultural thing as this happened a couple of times during our trip for other bookings we had made - you expect that once you book something, it stays booked, however it would seem that the Japanese like to make sure everything is reconfirmed on the day by a certain time otherwise your booking could be cancelled. On the whole I would recommend this hotel and when we revisit the amazing city of Tokyo we'll be looking to stay here again.

We spent 4 nights in this hotel. The foyer is small but modern and has a slightly cool vibe. We stayed in their premium modern double room and it is very old and dated. The room was clean and comfortable but the furnishing have all seen better days. There was a small in the bathroom that was persistent over the 4 days and I had to get a room spray during our stay. The mini fridge had to be reset before it would work and while the staff was very helpful, their English is really limited. I feel the hotel is letting them down a lot no matter how helpful the staff was. We did get free breakfast vouchers and the food was ok in the second floor restaurant. The cafe/bar breakfast was not up to par and the place looks a bit sad and untidy. The location is ok, not next to the station but lots of little places to eat and explore. We will not be back unless the hotel gets a refresh in all their rooms.

I don't know why people are saying this is an average hotel. It was close to excellent diner and drinking locations and near theShibuya crossing and drunkards alley. Being young and fairly "hipster" yet professional we loved it. There's a great udon place across the street and it was by far our favorite neighborhood in Tokyo. We were there for six nights.

The hotel is average with basic amenities. It is located close to the shibuya metro station. The rooms are very small, however it's enough to accommodate 1 person. The breakfast is ok. The staff is very strict about the check out time and not much flexible to extend by a few hrs even if you stay their for 10 days.

This hotel was in the Luxe guide and may have been great once a upon a time. We recognise that rooms in Tokyo can be small but we did not expect them to be dirty and to have to climb over a bed and furniture to negotiate our way across the room. Any chance of upgrading was to a smoking room only. Even smokers do not usually wish to have rooms that smell of smoke. The stars are for the excellent location and respect from the staff once we decided to leave.

Rooms are small, Tokyo-size. Nice modern, bathroom in the room separated by glass (and curtains), well equiped. Coffee, tea and water boiler, the lot. Breakfast downstairs in the bar, possibility to sit on the terrace, good coffee.

While rooms are small, they are certainly clean and wholesome. All facilities worked. It was a quiet hotel and beds were comfortable so sleep was not a problem. The decor of the corridors needs to be much brighter than the dark brown with subdued lighting currently employed. There is free Wifi of a good speed.Staff are very helpful. Checking in/out was as painless as it can be and there was no problem when I asked if I could leave a suitcase when I travelled away for two nights. Indeed, the suitcase was already placed within my new room when I returned.I think the weakest part of the stay was the quality of the breakfasts and the need to take a ticket. A greater variety of food would certainly enhance a stay at this hotel.The hotel does, however, give very good value for money and is well located near to Shibuya Railway Station. At first sight, the location of the hotel seemed a bit "rough" but it turned out not to be rough at all. There are no views (that I could tell of) but I was not there for the views. I basically wanted a warm/cool place to bed down for the night which was clean and comfortable. This hotel came up trumps in these respects and so I can unreservedly recommend it to any fellow traveller.
user_name:
VinRichley
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: Stayed here in early April for 4 nights. Excellent location <5 minutes from station, but location is quiet on a small street. Room is small but perfectly designed to maximize space. Helpful staff made restaurant reservations for us. Breakfast wasn't bad--I recommend the Japanese if you're on the fence. Highly recommended!

We stayed here a week ago for three nights. First off we found the staff very helpful. We were travelling around Japan and asked the staff before we left the UK whether we could leave some bags with them, they confirmed this was ok without hesitation. A small thing like this made our trip so much easier and enjoyable! And whilst there on accidentally leaving the room key in the room and shutting the door the staff were more than happy to make a replacement there and then. The room itself was very spacious, nicely decorated and had everything we needed. The location of the hotel is great, it is a stone's throw away from the famous Shibuya Crossing and very near to the station.

My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights. We had a premiere double room which was spacious. The room was quite clean and the bed was very comfortable. The toilet was in its own room and then there was an area with the sink and to the right was a big room with rain shower and tub.The staff was helpful when we inquired about restaurants in the area and they were overall very nice.The only thing you need to keep in mind is that the breakfast ends at 11 am and they are STRICT. My husband went into the restaurant (buffet one) at 11:10 to get a glass of orange juice and the girl working would not allow him to unless he paid but we had already paid in advance for the breakfasts (had it included in the price of room). Anyways just something to take note of, they are very punctual! But besides that, great hotel and great location.

The hotel is located at Shibuya crossing, which is very convenient to commute by train. The room itself is not big but comfortable enough. Free wifi is provided throughout the hotel. Unfortunately it is not very stable. It needs to reconnect most of the time. Breakfast comes in two styles, western and Japanese. The portion is very little. I recommend Japanese style. Western one is too little. I also recommend to have the meal at the restaurant on the second floor rather than the bar on the first floor.
