I had only one night at this hotel on my last visit to Tokyo before flying out the next afternoon.From the Hachiko Exit - head left, cross the road..walk up the hill past the record stores ( you'll see them) and the Granbell is on the left hand side of the street.Before I arrived, my friend and I had last minute flight changes due to work commitments, which left me checking in by myself, without having time to contact the hotel prior.The staff were very understanding and friendly, wasting no time to get me checked in.The rooms are what you would expect from a boutique style hotel in the Shibuya area. The only downfall I had was locating a Power outlet in the bathroom. I couldn't find it for the life of me! I didn't need it but maybe worth asking if you were to need a blow dryer etc.There are smoking / non smoking options as is the norm in Japan. I am a smoker so I do appreciate the choice.The beds are comfortable and of a decent size.I was able to meet with a friend for a drink in the area who found the hotel with ease, even though the hotel is relatively newish.I regret that I didn't have the time to visit the onsite bar as it looked quite good.The only thing I would suggest that guests do prior to arriving, is sort out the limousine bus pick up if flying out from Narita Airport. It picks up from the nearby Cerulean hotel, and would be well worth the extra $ for this transfer service of flying out early or mid afternoon.The Shibuya area is not directly connected via rail and there would be a couple of train changes, making the process a bit tiresome with luggage, not to mention the infamous 'Tokyo Crush' in peak hours.

I was Just in tokyo for a weekend break and this was one of the better hotels that i have stayed in in the city. the rooms were compact but not to small, there was at least some room. The bed and bedding was super comfortable, and they had great black out blinds which also makes for a good sleep. the room we had also came with a small window seat and table so it also had an are to do some work if needed. i was also impressed with the bathroom as it was super clean and new looking and the shower was nice and powerful (for Tokyo) it even had a deep bath, so deep not long.food wise i didn't have breakfast of eat at the restaurant, but what i could see it looked good. while i was there the roof top bar was closed, which was a shame but as its under renovation i think it will be a great space to hang out if you just can't face the hustle and bustle of Shinjuku. The hotel is situated in a "real" area of Tokyo. close to the subway station and near lots of Bars and restaurants. You could spend days just with-in one square mile of the hotel. i had a great time and will defiantly stay there again.

I stayed at the Granbell twice during my recent trip to japan. The hotel in in a great position, near the station in Shibuya and all the attractions. The hotel is nice and clean but what makes it exceptional is the staff. I was starting a tour in the affected region the day after the second earthquake and the staff helped me find information on the earthquake affected areas and assisted me in making alternative plans. They suggested places to visit and even hotels to book. A big thank you to Kim, Fukuoaki, Kana and Meiji and everyone else during a very stressful time.

On my one month trip I stayed in 18 hotels and this was my favourite. The most comfortable bed, beautiful rooms, lovely staff, average breakfast but such a comfortable stylish hotel in a great location. I wish I could have stayed longer! The guy who checked me in was also an absolute Gem!

We have great stay at this hotel for 5 nights. It is just a few minutes walk from Shibuya Station (West exit) and there are if you carry luggage don't worry there are lift to go up to the overhead pedestrian walking (refer to their website for walking to hotel from Shibuya station). Breakfast was fantastic in the hotel Level 2 restaurant they serve Ala carte Japanese or Western set.Check in process was quick as we arrive past 10pm and the staff speak English.If you plan to travel light there are coins laundry walking distance from the hotel (you can ask for the direction from the front counter reception).The hotel have umbrella and there was day when it was heavy rain we borrow an umbrella from the hotel to go Ginza to do shopping.The room is good and clean enough for us to sleep at night as we go out whole day long. If you want to ensure that you got a big room make sure you go to Shibuya Granbell Hotel official website to checkout on the range of room type they have that have room size and bed size configuration or alternatively call them and enquire. The only thing that this hotel does not have is baby basinet.

Stayed here for 1 week in early April. I was totally expecting a tiny mini hotel room - aka, a place to hang our hats.I was pleasantly surprised.Check in was fine - no issues or concerns. The man behind the counter was helpful, confirming our dinner reservations and whatnot, for area restaurants.The room was bigger than expected. Walk in shower, water closet (aka, toilet closet) - great sink/mirror/bathroom facilities. The room had a large bed - about queen sized. The view out the window was non-existent, but that was fine. No concerns. This was really a place to hang our hat.TV was good, location was perfect (6 minute walk to shibuya station) and we really felt that we were out of the touristy areas. Ice machine was convenient, as were the vending machines. I couldn't be more pleased on the value of this hotel.As for the "cons".. well, there is one - the breakfast.Don't bother. Yes, you've read this in other reviews on this hotel - the breakfast is rubbish. They really need to either scrap the whole thing, or revamp it to proper levels of "food". I wouldn't say it's non-edible, but I would say it just wasn't worth the walk downstairs/wait time. The american breakfast is more of an "appetizer" and the selection was pretty low. After 2 days, we just stopped going to the buffet/restaurant, and relied on 7/11 for snacks and coffee.Overall though, the location is perfect, the service is excellent, the wifi is FAST, the hotel is comfortable. Very pleased.

Shibuya Granbell Hotel is located very conveniently near Shibuya train station (5min walk) and so is easy to get to if you take the Narita Express (just make sure you take the 'New South Exit' at Shibuya station).The hotel itself is in a quiet little pocket of Shibuya, so no trouble sleeping at night, and yet very close to the lively part of Shibuya.The hotel is nicely presented and the rooms are modern and clean, although understandably a bit small given we're in Tokyo. The bathroom was equally clean and had a nice fit out. The glass window between the bathroom and the bedroom could make some couples uncomfortable, although there is a curtain that can be drawn to give privacy.The only thing that could be improved is the breakfast, which was rather small and bland. There are plenty of places nearby though where you can go and grab a katsu curry or other dish though, so it's no major issue.

For a recent business trip to Tokyo, decided to stay in Shibuya and found the Granbell Hotel which was located a short walk from the Shibuya Station and offered great prices on short notice.Finding the entry is a little confusing, you may see signs for an entrance on the side of the building by the parking garage entrance. This access has a a wooden door with a glass panel next to it, need to make sure to use the wood side since the glass is static and does not open.The actual main entrance to the hotel is located on the road to the right of the corner that the hotel sits on, just walk up the hill a short distance and you will see the large wooden door, give a good push since it is heavy and you will be right in the main lobby in front of the desk.Check in was quick and simply if you purchased and prepaid online, just hand your passport over, they will make a copy and issue your key. The elevators are fairly quick compared to some.Once you reach your floor, look for the signs indicating which way to go for your room number, the majority of the rooms are located to the right.I stayed in 2 different rooms over 2 nights since my stay was booked separately and had to change rooms which the staff made easy by having the new room cleaned and ready quickly. They also were happy to hold my bags and put them in my new room while I stepped out for lunch.It was nice to have this offered by the staff since other hotels tend to require you to ask if they will do such things.Overall the staff were all great and for those who do not speak Japanese, most all speak fairly good English.As for the rooms, they are typical of most Japanese business hotels in that they are not terribly large but compared to some they are fairly well laid out so that they did not feel overly cramped.One room lacked a closet, but offered a metal rail on the wall for hanging clothes, the other room had a nook (no door) with a hanging rod inside.Both rooms were very clean and offered more modern western like bathrooms that were more spacious that those at APA and other hotels I have stayed at.Both had Windows on the walls with curtains in case you are with someone and need some privacy.The smaller room lacked a tub, but had both a spray wand and a ceiling mounted rain head (that offered very good pressure)I do suggest in using caution when turning on the hot water as it heats up quickly and is scalding hot if you do not set it correctly. I found leaving the handle set at the mid point was a comfortable setting.WiFi for the most part was pretty good and fast, just during the second night it would sporadically lose connectivity repeatedly. Also if you plan to use a VPN to stream shows from foreign locations, don't bother as they have those services blocked like most Japanese hotels.The hotel offers an onsite restaurant and cafe, I only tried the cafe (Cona) which was pretty good and offered individual sized pizzas that were similar to wood fired styles found in the US.Finding the hotel was pretty easy from Shibuya Stations, simply exit and then head for the main square, then turn left if exiting from the Metro sections (Ginza Line) and follow the building towards the back side past the JR ticket terminals in front of the bus stops.Then head for the overhead walkway and go straight across and drop down (you should be right next to the wall of pink/red paper lanterns). Keep straight until you reach the weird 4 way interaction, then go right up the hill and the hotel will be on your left.Lots of great places to eat and drink nearby.

This clean, modern and bright hotel is located in an excellent position for exploring Shibuya. Its literally minutes over a road bridge from the famous crossing and the vibrant shopping and nightlife district. The rooms are stylish and comfortable with a good-sized bed although they were a little on the warm side during the winter months. The corridors are a little dark but it adds to the trendy moodiness of the hotel. There's a decent little bar downstairs and a good breakfast is served in the restaurant.The staff were great. Thumbs up!

room was fine, but I had to take a star off for the walk over that pedestrian elevated crosswalk. It's not fun. It's annoying with suitcases. However, we discovered that the crosswalk actually has an elevator! It's next to the convenience store on the side nearest the hotel. We discovered this the day we were leaving, wish the hotel had mentioned it. Still, the crosswalk mentally separates you from the station and made us reluctant to go back or leave the hotel. Maybe it won't bother u as much. I took the second star off for the breakfast. We tried the set breakfast first, not terrible, but not exactly filling, very little variety. The next morning we tried the other hotel restaurant with the buffet. Big mistake. Awful. Not clean. The eating area is actually a bar in the evening and it looked like they were still mopping up beer. Soggy sausages. Soggy eggs. Stale bread that you have to toast yourself. Burned coffee from an automatic machine. Overall, the rooms were large and comfortable and modern. The lobby was nice and friendly. We just think for the same price in Tokyo we can do without the elevated walkway and the bad breakfast.

This was a beautiful room, loads of space, huge double bed and lovely modern bathroom. Great location, walking distance from the famous Shibuya crossing and other sites. Staff are very friendly and breakfast is great. We were on a low level room and there was no noise from the streets below

We were visiting our family that lives in Japan, and Shibuya seemed like the most convenient area. The Granbell Hotel was reasonably priced, and had decent reviews so we took the plunge. First, understand that unless you book high end hotels in Japan, your room will be small according to western standards. The Granbell is no exception. The bed is against the bathroom wall, the desk just fits, and walking room is narrow. That said, the room was functional, quiet, had free wifi, and the bed was comfortable. We slept well. They had two free breakfasts available, one served and one buffet. Choose the restaurant breakfast, the service was good, you could choose between western and Japanese style breakfast, and both were fine. The buffet seemed to have irregular hours, the person manning the buffet was surly at best, and even thoug hthe selection was fine, the plates were set up on the bar with no heating, so food got cold quickly.

We had a very comfortable 3 nights at the Granbell. The location is great, once you find your way out of the maze that is Shibuya station (metro exit 16 if you don't mind stairs). There are loads and loads of bars and restaurants nearby. The room was typically small for a Tokyo hotel, but not too bad and the bathroom worked well. We slept very well in the bed. The room was a little tired and the carpet was stained by a past guest. Breakfast was great and we enjoyed both the Japanese and Western breakfasts.

Just a few minutes from Shibuya station. Comfortable and beautiful room and free a breakfast in japanese, western and french style in not expensive price. A hotel have many staffs to help you 24 hrs. You can find many restaurant around there. 5 mins to Shinjuku, 15 mins to Shinnagawa 30 to Akihabara.

Absolutely loved this hotel. A couple minute walk from the Shibuya Train Station and 5 minutes from Shibuya Crossing and all the fun that the city has to offer. Chose the super small room which was part of the fun experience of being in Japan, it was nice for a couple nights. The staff is super nice and helpful. The only complaint that I had is that the breakfast was terrible, couldn't even stomach the sausage and the cereal was brand. Also, their little restaurant plays music till 1:30 A.M every night, it was right below our room and extremely loud. The WIFI is super spotty and kicks you out every 10 minutes and won't let you log back on for another 30, pretty terrible even when it did work.All in all I was super impressed with this hotel, especially for such a great price point.

Room is small, lighting not enough, breakfast too simple not tasty. HK$1,700/ night not value for money. I stayed Shinjuku Granbell before， much better than Shibuya. Bathroom is alright. Just location is good. I think lot of choices in Tokyo.

This was the last hotel we stayed in while in Japan. The room was unfortunately kinda small but it was in a pretty nice location. Due to the odd front door situation it was almost hidden when we were looking for the hotel the first day. We probably could have chose better.

We just arrived today and have booked 4 rooms. The premier twin and modern double didnt had air conditioning and told us to open the windows for cold air instead. Each staff gave different reasons from only summer time has air con to he manager saying only certain floors have cold air during this time! It was just too noisy with the windows opened! How ridiculous can it be?! The manager was so unhelpful and unfriendly! This happened when we 1st check in to the rooms. Till the night after we came back from dinner...it was still not sorted out. Worst eva experience in tokyo!

Great location right next to Shibuya crossing and Hachiko statue, really easy to get anywhere from there. Room was small-ish but still the biggest in our Japan stay, with big window offering an amazing night view. Staff is very professional and kind, they helped us book a taxi to the airport on our last night.Complementary breakfast - recommended to visit the delicious Japanese restaurant on 2nd floor. Don't use your breakfast ticket on the restaurant located at the entrance. Very limited selection that looks cheap and everything is dirty. Staff there was nice but looked too careless.

A boutique hotel right in the heart of Shibuya, with a fantastic coffee shop just nearby called 'Doutor'. Hotel was quiet, well maintained and really clean. Hotel team spoke reasonable English and were accommodating. Best in mind you often can't check in before 2pm. Yes, the rooms are smaller than western hotels but this is in the heart of Tokyo where ground space is expensive and the rooms are still a reasonable size and you can stay without feeling cramped. The shower in our room was amazing! Worth a stay and worth the money we paid.

I normally like staying in big hotels but I booked this one based on reviews here in Tripadvisor and pictures of the room. Booked the Penthouse Suite 6mons prior to our trip and was able to get a huge discount! Our room was amazing! Huge windows that extended until the 2nd flr where the bathroom was located. The bathtub is adjacent to a window, as well. Free breakfast (the Japanese breakfast was yum!) and wifi.But what I loved most about this is the location. Walking distance from the Shibuya crossing and metro station. Nearby, there are tons of restaurants to choose from!

good queensize beds, one of the best I ever slept in!good staff! realy good showers (in the queensize room, but probubly the same in all)breakfast we okey, not so much to choose from but 3,5/5 for breakfastclose to good places so realy recommended!

Room was decent for a hotel in such a good location, big enough to be comfortable in with 2 people and luggage. Hotel is less than 5 minutes walk from the Hachiko exit of Shibuya station so you're never far from the action or the station. Only downside was the room and the hotel was uncomfortably hot, on the third day I did figure out how to open the window in our room which was a life saver but im not sure they want you to open the window as it looked like the handle to do so had been removed. The western breakfast was pretty average. Overall would definitely go back

Had a 5 night stay, premier double room small, but you expect that in Japan, bathroom was great, no view in our room however, bed very comfy. Inclusive Breakfast was average in the two available restaurants, but we have experienced this in Japan in general. Location is absolutely outstanding, plenty of restaurants close, Sakura izakazi 20m up the road was delicious and so so cheap. Shibuya scramble and Station is a 5 minute walk at best, nice and close. Overall impressed with hotel, would stay again

Room was small, but we made it work without any issues. Skip the breakfast offered on the first floor and head to the restaurant upstairs instead - both are free with your room. Location is within walking distance to the train station and there's lots to do close by.

Arrived from Haneda Airport early and early check-in was unavailable that morning. While waiting I went to their cafe/restaurant for breakfast. Food choice wasn't vast but the manager was kind enough to comp that breakfast, seeing the wait was quite lengthy. The property has a sizeable 24-hour Family Mart right down the street(3 minutes walking or less) for midnight munchies and etc! Like many Tokyo hotels, the room's small but it's expected. Its decor is modern and easy on the eyes. Walk and go up a footbridge comes Shibuya Crossing and all happening places. Recommended!

The hotel is situated in good location, price payed was a little high but the hotel staff were very helpful.Room was very big and the bed was soft and comfy.The breakfast is nothing special but the food was tasty.

Very tiny rooms, and ours had zero view...of a brick wall (on the 3rd floor). Close to Shibuya station and shops/restaurants, but far enough away that it's quiet. Breakfast was good. Room was good enough for a short stay--but again, very tiny (per many Tokyo hotel rooms). Ok value for $, but not great. But if you want to stay in Shibuya...

The hotel is very well located next to Shibuya station. The rooms are small but nicely planned and very clean. The breakfast was good, with Japanese and Western options. The area is great full of restaurants within walking distance. Very good for the price!!

It's a bit of a 10 min walk from the station, a bit of pain if you have to lug big bags as you have to go up this road crossing walk way and it's about 100 m up a hill. Apart from that very nice little rooms. Clean and conviently. It's not in the middle of the shibuya crazyness but close enough for a wonder around.

First time in Japan, so we caught a cab from Shibuya Station to the hotel. It was only 300 yards away which was a little embaressing! Tip. If catching cabs have address available in Japanese. We stayed here for 3 nights. Reception check in swift, as was check out. We had a double comfort and two single rooms. Our double room was very quiet. All rooms have really great facilities from cotton bedlinen, bathroom accessories plus daily bottles of water when rooms cleaned. Showers excellent. Luxury of warm seated loo as well! Kettle with coffee, tea and powdered creamer. Wardrobe. Safe.We had one medium case in the double room which was accommodated well space wise. Rooms were a little warm as noted in previous reviews however it is very easy to turn off the heating. Reception helpful with one sons room due to heating misbehaving but they came and unlocked the window, turned off the heating which solved the heat problem.....but the open window caused some night street noise. All of our rooms had windows which could be opened. (You mayweed some assistance from reception). Breakfast included and two venue choices - we tried both. The 2nd floor restaurant food good, Japanese or Continental choice arrived on tray, self serve coffee, tea, juice. Much preferred Breakfast in lobby Bar - good coffee, we had self serve small sausages, Japanese sides, scrambled eggs, croissants, toast plus I believe there was also cereal.Hotel WiFi Good.Hotel very well located for eating - many restaurants really close to the hotel to choose from. The Hotel 'bar' with pizza oven excellent - great pizza's for 8Yen each. Noticed a few Jazz Bars in a nearby street but didn't make it ... this time!The hotel is a quick walk to main Shibuya shopping area and also the main station. BTW, we walked back to the Station on our departure, no taxi !

Poor wifi connection inside the room. The key card had to be reprogrammed at least three times during my two nights stay. The tiniest room I've ever been and no windows. Location is a bit of a walk from the subway station and you have to climb the overpass which is not fun with your luggage. However, it's close to Shibuya crossing.

From Shibuya station go to Granbell hotel it's not easy for me. I think it is because Shibuya is a busy and crowd area. To go to the hotel, you need to cross a footbridge, and that footbridge has many ways, I cannot recognize which one I should go down.The location of hotel is opposite to the shopping area in Shibuya, so after shopping, you need to bring your bags walking to the hotel around 10-15 minutes.The decoration in the hotel is new and colorful, I really like it.For the breakfast, there are two restaurants you can choose, but the meal is a set, not buffet.

Booked this hotel at the last minute, and not really knowing Tokyo it was in a great location to explore. However, arriving there, you're not really sure what to think, as it is not really in an upscale location.Reception was busy when we arrived and could not check in early, and the staff was not very helpful when we asked for recommendations for lunch even though they gave us a map.We stayed in the suite, which is great value for money, it's a duplex and very spacious with a lovely bathtub (though we didn't use it) and great shower (good heat and pressure).Overall the stay was alright but I would say the customer service needs to be worked on - on our last day, we wanted to order food from the restaurant downstairs but they kept getting our order wrong/mixed up/just didn't understand that we needed it quickly as we had to catch the train. Managed to eat anyway, but left a sour taste in our mouths. Not sure we would stay again.

Pros:- Excellent location, just 10 mins walk to Shibuya crossing and less than 5 mins walk to the JR station. From the JR station, you can easily go to all the JR stops (such as Tokyo station for the Shinkansen and the Shinjuku station, to name a few). The Shibuya area itself is good for shopping as there are plenty of malls and global fashion stores. Very close to the Shibuya crossing is the Cat café, incase anyone is interested in going there. Also there are plenty of places to eat in Shibuya and very close to the hotel.- Tidy room and bathroom. Pyjamas are also provided which as very comfy- Excellent customer service: We arrived from NZ at 7:30am at the hotel and the staff were kind enough to store our luggage and also had a room ready by 12pm (usual check-in is 2pm). We were very grateful. Later on we had some problem with the air con and the front desk staff immediately came to our room to sort it out. They are very helpful and efficient.- We chose to have the buffet breakfast which was tasty and had a decent spread (eggs, sausages, juice, salad, croissant, lychee, etc)- Room is small (we stayed in a double room) but very tidy and not too claustrophobic. We had 1 large suitcase and 2 travel bags and it was easy to store them in the room.- Shuttle from the airport drops you at the Cerulean Hotel which is a 5 min walk to Shibuya Granbell. Just walk out from where the bus dropped you and with your back facing the hotel, take a right and walk till the end of that pathway until you see Family mart on your Right. Immediately turn right and keep walking straight, cross the road and when you reach the 2nd crossing, turn right again and the hotel will be on your left.Cons:- The double room is only 20sq m. which is suitable if you are not going to spend too much time in the hotel and only if it is for a day or two. Else get a bigger room.- If you are travelling with friends or with a big family, I would not recommend the double room as the bathroom is just next to the bed and there is lack of privacy.- No views as such from the hotel

I stayed at this hotel a few years back, which led me to book it again on a recent trip. As before the service was first class, the hotel and room clean and tidy and the location very convenient for exploring Tokyo. It's walking distance from Shibuya station, which can get you anywhere in Tokyo, yet the area is quiet at night. So, yet again a great experience.

Super convenient location just minutes from Shibuya station, a great base for exploring Tokyo. As with most hotels in Japan, rooms are small but comfortable. The Japanese breakfast is a nice start to the day and the bar is convenient in the evening if you're exhausted! Would definitely stay again, I thought it was good value.
user_name:
Lisa B
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: 4-5min walk from the exit of Shibuya station(just across the overhead bridge), countless eateries and shops around the area. The check in process was fast. Hotel room was spacious and very clean. The only downside was the rooms were pre set to 27 degrees as it was cold outside (temperature outside was approximately 13-14 degrees celsius), so the room ended up feeling stuffy, we were advised to open the window for fresh air but because the hotel is located on a busy street, the noise levels were pretty high when we did that, affecting our ability to sleep well.

I wanted to stay somewhere nice in Tokyo because we were just there on a long layover. This hotel is in a great spot and has very friendly staff, but definitely needs some TLC. There were chips on the corners of the walls, the carpet in the hallway was worn, and there was mold in the bathroom. For about the same price, I'd skip this and stay in the Claska.

So on first impressions of the room.. it was tiny! And we had even paid extra to get a 'double' size room. But after traveling around Japan, you will soon learn that the Granbell's double size room is actually quite spacious in comparison to other Japanese hotels of similar price range. If you're used to spacious living, I suggest paying a bit more for the space.Breakfast is included and there are 2 options, there is a more restaurant style with set menus and a buffet which is more like a cafe/bar. We personally liked the restaurant style more. The customer service in the restaurant was absolutely splendid.The wifi had a strong connection and the room was cleaned each day! It was so nice to have fresh bottled water in our room each day. The air con could only be controlled to a certain extent in our room, so it was a lot warmer than we would have liked.Now.. location! This hotel has an amazing location!! It's on a side street which means its quiet when you want to go to bed at night but only minutes away from the craziness of Shibuya! It's also very close to the Shibuya Station which literally is a hub to get you pretty much anywhere in Tokyo. From Narita airport we took a limousine bus to the Cerulean Tower and walked with our suitcases, as I had studied maps before the trip it wasn't too difficult to find our hotel.Overall I would definitely stay there again!

The Shibuya Granbell is tucked away in a side street a mere 5 minutes walk from the Shibuya crossing - so it’s fairly quiet at night but still very close to all the action. I stayed in their single room and I was actually surprised on how spacious the room was. The bathroom was the width of the room and it had a separate shower, basin and toilet, all well spaced out and with lots of shelving so I could easily place my belongings.The room itself had ample space for my suitcase, and writing desk and a comfortable single bed pushed against the wall. Breakfast was great - each morning I opted for the Japanese option as when you’re in Japan, do as the Japanese do.The only negative comment I had (which seems apparent across Japan) is excessive temperature setting in the rooms, lobby, and pretty much throughout the hotel. I’m convinced it was set to at least 30 degrees celsius and there were times that I could’ve begun my own hot yoga session in my room! To mitigate me passing out I’d open the window which made it a lot more comfortable.For $100 per night (in Tokyo especially) you really can’t go wrong. I’d defientely stay here again.

It was in a perfect location, close to Roppongi and Harajuku, right at the Shibuya station and very convenient to take the metro to anywhere. The rooms though small are functional and have everything one would want, from a small fridge, kettle, to a safe, slippers, a very good powerful hot shower and of course very clean rooms. What more can one ask for. For a very reasonable price, they threw in a good breakfast at their 2nd floor dining area (go early-ish!) with 3 choices, Japanese, American or (delectable) French toast!

Great location. Just a few minutes walk from Shibuya Station, the famous Shibuya crossing and the airport bus stop. Restaurants, shops and night life all around. Our double room was clean but very squashy (almost impossible) for two people's luggage. Decor is an attempt at modern style but makes me feel uncomfortable. Breakfast was included and you get a choice of either continental or Japanese. We went with continental at the bar and found that everything about it was very ordinary. If I need a hotel here again, this won't be my top choice.

It's modern, somewhat chic, and clean at a very fair price. It's not much more than that unfortunately. The room is tiny for a basic single (you'll have a hard time with two people getting around without bumping into each other). For the bed for two people, you can't get over to the desk without one person at least going over the other person (so not much walking space and the bed is weirdly positioned relatively speaking so that it's not the front or back emptying in the walk space but instead the side of the bed). The wifi is free and fast. There's also breakfast included. In November, it was freezing and raining outside -- the staff provided umbrellas which was nice. Inside though, it was super hot/dry and it seemed like the most they could do was open a window.The staff is English friendly and friendly in general.It's about 2-3 big blocks separated from the train station and from most of the action in Shibuya it would seem.I see this as a no frills, good value play for being in a happening neighborhood but still removed enough that it isn't super noisy.

I landed at Narita Airport at 8 a.m. with a departing flight out of Haneda at midnight. Took the train into Shibuya, tried to find a locker and ATM with no luck. My large rolling duffel was too big so I rented, after some negotiation at the front desk, a room for partial rate as I left at about 9pm that evening. I didn't sleep there, mostly used for charging my phone, Wi-Fi and shower although I gave it 5 stars because I've never seen a toilet like that.It's the only hotel room I've ever been in in Tokyo, teenie tiny, TV didn't seem to work but was superb location and worked well for me.

excellent location in a quiet area of shibuya. Rooms are quite small thus they only allow 2 persons per room. Breakfast is excellent with set meals to choose from. Modern ambiance make the hotel rooms more spacious. will stay here again in the future

Pros include the modern building and medium sized rooms with super strong shower, two ok breakfast options and friendly staff.Cons include terrible internet. Not being able to checkin an hour early (late checkin seems normal in Japan).Maybe get one of those internet boxes to cover you throughout Tokyo instead of relying on the hotel's internet and free hotspots which mostly don't work.Strong option all things considered.

Great hotel, just a few mins from the Shibuya crossing, where I love to feel the craziness of Tokyo. Modern space and decor, great rooms, nice neighborhood (restaurants, train station, everything nearby). The personnel is super attentive! Two optional restaurants for breakfast - Japanese (we wouldn't dare) and Western (good enough!).

Nice elegant hotel at an affordable price in the heart of Shibuya. 2m walk from the cross junction. Small like all rooms in Japan but great decoration, clean and modern with a glass wall separating the room from the toilet, Definitely recomend it.

Trendy décor and nice spacious rooms provide an ideal venue and facilities for visitors. Would stay here again.It is located 3 minutes walk (stairs can be avoided if you have heavy bags) from Shibuya station via the West exit. Station has Narita Express train to Airport (ticket price included if you have JR Pass but seats need to be reserved in advance) Pass also takes you to other areas like Tokyo Station and Shinjuku and many more tourist attractions on the JR loop line.

I mistakenly booked a small double room at the Granbell and when my daughter and I turned up at 6am in the morning there was a lot of concern from the staff about the room suitability ! No problem .... a couple of quick conversations and we were put into a much larger double room on the 9th floor (room 905) with lots of space. The room was also immaculate as were the general areas of the hotel. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly the whole time. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from Shibuya station so transport links were excellent. There is a bar downstairs (Cona) which serves basis pizza and pasta which is pretty good if you haven't got the energy to go out. We really liked it and would definitely stay again. A good breakfast too is ivy place which is about 10 minutes walk away.

Stayed at the granbell in sep. yes room sizes are small but they are clean,modern and best of all is the great location of the hotel. Very close to the station and great restaurants nearby. We travelled with my one year and had to keep the stroller in the hallway as otherwise it would have taken up too much space in the hallway. Breakfast in both restaurants is very basic but there is lots of family marts and 7/11 close by to buy yogurts, fresh fruits and pastries. In addition to all the restaurants in the station. Can't beat the location and vibe in shibuya.

Perfect location 200m from Shibuya station. Walking distance to Shibuya Crossing. Only 1 train stop away or a 10 minute walk to Harajuku! It really is so convenient! The rooms are small yet clean and modern. All the staff were very friendly.

This hotel is within walking distance of airport shuttle drop off and Shibuya train station. Great value and excellent location. The rooms are of a size that you can turn around and keep a suit case. Breakfast selection is limited but good. The wifi connection in the room is a bit sketchy.

The hotel is centrally located, being just a short 5 minute walk from Shibuya station. There are a number of restaurants and cafes near the hotel, as well as a Family Mart.Room is small as to be expected for hotels in Tokyo, but it is nevertheless comfortable and clean.

Modern small rooms with free wi fi. Western breakfast is adequate but average. Only 200 meters from Shibuya station and 300 meters from the famous crossing. Hundreds of restaurants to choose from in the area.

Our first room had mold all over the shower and smelt of cigarettes even though it was on a non smoking floor. We complained and were moved to another room. There was still a little bit of mold in the new room's shower but no where as bad as the previous room. The room was shabby but relatively clean. Although it could be better. Stain couch and dirty walls. The room's view was of a wall.The location is the only win for this hotel. It is really close the Shibuya's main street. It is in a quieter area of Shibuya which is a relief after being out and about all day.The breakfast resembles aeroplane food. Seriously, I've had better meals on most airlines. We only went once for breakfast and didn't bother returning as it is inedible. Don't waste your time going for breakfast as there are way better options around. We went to Hoshino Coffee which is close by for breakfast (Just past the guitar shop). They do awesome souffle pancakes for like 750 yen. The staff are pleasant but there is a language barrier and most of the time they could not understand what I was asking. For example: where can we rent bikes and the whole mold situation. But we are in Japan, so it is totally forgiven. I actually should have brushed up on my Japanese before coming over.All in all, there are much better hotels out there but for our budget and wanted location this was ok I guess. It is definitely at the lower end of the 'ok' spectrum.

I guess for the price I expected more. The location is good. 5 min walk from Shibuya station, and the size and standard of the rooms where good compared to other Japanese hotels. Disappointing view from the 11th floor, basically only a wall and 1 square inch of sky. Small and unimpressive breakfast split into western- and japanese-style. Should have been both up in the food court, not one on the bar. So little food that you could easily fit those two together.

Needed to stay here for one night when we first arrived as our apartment was not ready for the first night. The hotel was fine, location is good. I found the room very small – although I hadn’t booked the one of the bigger rooms. There is a nice little area outside to sit and watch the world go by. Breakfast was basic but ok.

Japanese are known for their details. They showed that in this Hotel. Our room was okay. No fuss but it's kinda small for a double room. Note that the hotel has 2 buildings. 1 is called the Main and the other is Annex. Main rooms are way better than Annex but it will cost more. Breakfast!!! Hmmm.. I can eat better breakfast at other 3 stars hotel outside Japan. Well, Tokyo is a high density city. Space is crucial for them so as the rooms. If you have more money, go for Cerulean 5 stars or Excel 4 stars in Shibuya. Other 3 stars would be Appa, new boutique hotel..

The hotel is in an amazing location, 10 minutes walk from JR, subway and major bus terminal in Shibuya but hidden enough so you're not in it all the time. The room is exceptionally big in comparison to normal Tokyo hotel (maybe we got upgraded, I'm not sure) The bathroom have rain shower and even a bathtub, and the toilet is the Japanese toilet of course.Staff speaks great English and very helpful. I highly recommend this hotel if it's not out of your budget.

Friendly staff, quiet room, close to transport, food and bars. Clean and tidy. Comfortable bed with good linen. Great no frills hotel. Would recommend to friends. Breakfast included was a plus with western, French and Japanese choice of meal.

We spent four nights here and found the location to be excellent. A few minutes' walk from the train station and the main sights of Shibuya, it was an excellent base for exploring Tokyo. We spent hardly any time in the room itself, which was small and basic, but fitted with everything we needed. We also found some delightful restaurants and bars in the neighbourhood immediately around the hotel, including a wine bar at the bottom of the hill with a lovely European wine list and tapas. The staff were very helpful and responsive. The breakfast was pretty ordinary - so we just ate out each day.
user_name:
TheSecondSmiths
New York City, New York

review_body: Location good. Just a 5 min walk diagonnaly across JR Station. We were greeted with an amazing gigantic swivel wooden door at the front !! Very nice cute design hotel. Like most hotels in Tokyo, Granbell is pretty small but very comfortable especially i love the hot shower n powerful water in bathroom. Bed is very comfortable. When we walk a lot in Tokyo you want to come back to a comfortable bed n hot shower ! Free coffee n tea facility in the lobby 24 hrs. Its only 8 min walk to the famous Shibuya Crossing too.

Hotel location is very good. it is opposite side of busy Shibuya. Here is nice and comfortable. The room I staying is Executive Suite and Penthouse Suite. The room lay out is incredible, it is small ( if you are american) bit it very practical, functional and very comfortable. I feelLike home. Nespresso coffee machine and full big box of coffee capsules in the room! ( only 8th fl. Room has it and also vending machine) Bed,Bed Sheet, linens are good. Excellent services but... I found that the room are dusty.

Being lost in a country that nothing is in english is hard especially when your phone dies and all you have to go off is landmarks!well this hotel did great with directions!!! i managed to find my way there without to much hassle.very close to the train station and right in the heat if the city, close to the famous crossing.very cute stylish room, very compatible.i felt very safe traveling by myself and staying there.

We stayed for five days during our honey moon at the end of May. The hotel has a great location thanks to its proximity to Shibuya station (one of the main public transportation hubs in Tokyo), its staff is very friendly and provide excellent recommendations for restaurants. In our case, being our Honey Moon, they had really lovely special details with us. This type of things is what makes the difference in a city hotel

Great affordable option while staying in Shibuya. Small stylish hotel located about 5 minutes walking from Shibuya station, Shibuya crossing, the Hachiko statue, and a convenient location for getting around Tokyo in general. There's also a 7-11 right around the corner in case you need snacks or drinks late at night. Hotel staff is really friendly and helpful, and speak conversational English at minimum, so checking in was really smooth as well as getting advice on exploring Shibuya and Tokyo. I stayed in a single room which I thought was a comfortable size for a solo traveler. From inside my room it was pretty quiet and I couldn't hear a lot of noise from the hallway or outside the hotel, so noise problems never came up. Staying at the hotel also comes with a free breakfast at the restaurant inside, which I really enjoyed. The only downside was that the wifi was a little slow. Otherwise I think this is a great spot if you’re looking to stay in the heart of Shibuya.

Friendly hotel, very nearby Shibuya junction, 7-11 store just around the corner, a good base for exploring Tokyo. Lots of good restaurants nearby. We enjoyed our stay. Would happily recommend. Two eating areas, with free wifi and left luggage facility.

Stayed here for work recently and it was a great location! 5 min walk from Shibuya station and close to shops and restaurants.Single room was clean, modern and big enough for me to keep my luggage laid out on the floor.Great toiletries included too.Didn't try the breakfast included but my colleague said he enjoyed both the western and Japanese options.Having been to Tokyo before, I wasn't too fussed with the breakfast as I know that Tokyo has so many good food options that are affordable!Would stay here again even if it wasn't for work.

The price of hotel rooms in Japan is not cheap, especially in some of Tokyo's more popular areas. This is the second time I have stayed in Shibuya. I chose the Granbell because of its location and great value rate.It is minutes walk away from Shibuya station, which is a stop on the Narita Express, every half hour. So that's the airport transfer taken care of. There are elevators if you don't want to climb the overpass stairs with your bags.My check-in went smoothly but when I got to my room, which was compact, but with a good size bathroom - Comfort Double - the carpet was badly stained. I am sure it is cleaned every day and you can't expect a full carpet shampoo to be done each time you have slovenly guests but it just spoiled things. It really was grubby looking and that put you off taking your shoes off when in the room. I asked if I could change rooms. The manager came up to take a look and agreed that it was stained. Unfortunately they didn't have any rooms available except smoking rooms. So I asked if he would mind refunding me the money so I could change hotels - I had just paid cash for my stay. While he was prepared to do this, the manager made a few phone calls and then took me up to another room which, while on a smoking floor, only had a few rooms and the room he showed me was at the opposite end from the other rooms and extremely large. There was no cigarette smell and I really appreciated the room change and the professional and helpful way everything was handled, which is something I can say for all the staff who I met. The room was spotless, and was more like a suite. This hotel is in a great location for restaurants, bars, shopping and trains to just about anywhere. If you don't want to take the Narita Express, you are a few minutes walk from the Cerulean Hotel, where you can pick-up the airport limousine bus.The view from the 40th floor bar at the Cerulean is also worth the 5-star cost of a drink. Breakfast was included in my Granbell rate, but I only ate once. You have a choice of two restaurants where you can eat. At the restaurant I chose you have a choice of menu sets - Japanese, eggs and bacon or french toast and bacon. Is it something to rave about? No, but it is not stingy and it will set you up for the day. Plus the staff, again, were really great. Overall, I think this is a really good hotel to consider if you're looking at this area and want good value that doesn't let you down on service.

This is the second time I've stayed at the Granbell in Shibuya. This time i was in a single Annex room, the room was a great size for me, the bed was nice and big and comfortable and the shower and toilet were clean and modern.I really can't fault the place, it's clean and modern and the location is perfect and the price is fantastic!!Can't wait to stay here again.. :)

We stayed twice... on arrival in Japan and then again for another two days at the end. Amazing breakfast is included (Japanese ... didn't try the western). Such a reasonable price for room with breakfast! Reception staff are just so friendly and really helpful - they helped to book a bus to airport and arranged taxi to bus stop. Rooms are funky, comfortable and clean. Bathrooms great. Location is great too - 5 mins to Shibuya station, yet it's in a quiet 'neighbourhood' style area. Great restaurants nearby. Nice pizza bar downstairs in the hotel too. We will be back Granbell :)

Checked in today to their Premiere Double room. Room was a bit small but is as expected. Check in was also fast and smooth. The staff did try to answer my queries, but unfortunately could not really speak English. The room on the whole was clean, but there were some stains on the little sofa and the coffee table was rather dirty, look like some chocolate was stuck on it. The windows also faced a blank wall of an adjacent building. Also, quite a bit of noise as guest opening and closing their room doors and talking in the corridor can be heard quite loudly. On the plus side, the wifi is good and the location easy.

Highly recommended by me. Close to Shibuya Station/Crossing, fast and free wifi. Fairly large rooms for Tokyo standard (premier double). Good to travel the city as all major lines depart from Shibuya. Nightlife, restaurants more than you can ever try in the area, just a couple on minutes to walk from the hotel.Very quiet also.

Stayed for only a few nights but enjoyed coziness of a little room, makes you feel like staying in a safe place, like an oasis of huge city. Great location, helpful staff and a tasty food in restaurant next door. You should try staying in its sister hotel, Shinjuku Grandbell as well. Seems like a lot of thoughts has been put into designing Grandbell hotel.

This hotel is quite new, so it has all the mod cons. It's in a good location in Shibuya, just a short walk from Shibuya Train station. If there are two of you, don't get a room smaller than Modern Double, as (typical to Japanese style) the rooms are small. The staff are excellent. Check out the "early bird specials" on their website, as you can often save a decent amount using that. I've also stayed in the Bath Suite, and while the view was AMAZING and worth every penny, the suit itself was a little shabby considering it was meant to be the penthouse suite, plus the shower leaked water everywhere. But I think it's a great hotel and I've already booked for my September holiday.

The location of this hotel is great! It's close to the JR Shibuya station and you can either take the train or airport limousine (bus) from Haneda or Narita airports. The subway lines here are also great for exploring around Tokyo. It is walking distance to shopping and great food, as well as the Tokyu mall just at the train station. It is very close to the famous Shibuya crossing. The hotel itself is lovely and small. I have stayed in the single bed option previously, as well as the Premium double. This time we stayed in the Comfort double. It is a good size but you have to remember that this is Japan, and space is a premium. The bathroom is all glass and only has a curtain to cover up. So if you're not very comfortable with your partner, or if this is your first trip overseas together, you might want to reconsider and get the Premium double instead. The rooms are also quiet despite being near the train station.This time round, there was a slight drainage smell coming from our bathroom but it was fine when we shut the bathroom door. The service staff are friendly and very helpful.This is my third time staying here and I will always choose to stay here and recommend it.

Near Shibuya station (10 minutes walk) the hotel is very convenient. There are many restaurants in the area so great if you want to go out.The staff is very nice, helpful and professional. The room itself was very dark but very comfortable. Nespresso coffee was offered.Everything was good except the breakfast... bad quality products, not a lot of choice... it could be much better!

Close to train station, lots of convenience store, coffee shops, restos, bookstores and bars. Housekeeping did a good job cleaning the bathroom, refilling out toiletries and cleaning our room. Japanese breakfast was good. Small room but thats what it is Japan.

just back from my 6th or 7th stay here... The manager chatted to me and expressed his concern that this hotel should be like my home in Tokyo - It is :-) It is quirky yet practical and outstanding value. But the best bit is its location and the staff. Hirohiko-san (?) the manager, is a wonderful constant for me and so very kind. Likewise, the Japanese breakfast on level 2 and the gentleman that runs the restaurant just lovely. As someone that travels as much as me, these personal aspects far outweigh fanciness. Things aren't always perfect, but the attention to making things right and genuinely welcoming you is what brings me back - and will again.

This really is an excellent hotel, and factoring in the vale I would give it a ratting of excellent.It located a short walk to the Shibuya JR / Metro station; it has good wifi, and a variety of nice breakfast options. It's clean, with a very helpful English speaking staff. Most of the rooms are small, but on par with hotel rooms in Tokyo. The neighborhood has a number of good restaurants within a short walk of the Granbell.It's a small hotel with a good heart. I had fairly high expectations based on the reviews, and it cleared those easily, and I would stay there again.

A great little hotel, friendly staff and the location is perfect only 300 meters from Shibuya train station, this alone makes for a great base for your trip, the hotel is easy to find just out of the south exit from the station then across the bridge and you can see it from the coffee shop on your left. very close to the shibuya crossing and the nightlife. the hotel is small but you are in tokyo and i think for the price this is a must for anyone wanting a clean place to put there head down whilst exploring all this great city has to offer!

This is a great little property in the heart of Tokyo. Considering the price that we paid, for the location, this property was completely worth it. We stayed here for 2 nights on the first leg of our Japan trip. The rooms are very small (it was a tough fit for my mum and I and our luggage) but we only really came back to the room to sleep, so we managed just fine. The hotel offers free wifi which is great, and upon check in we also realised breakfast was complimentary which was a great plus point. Location wise, this property couldn't be more convenient. Shibuya station is about 5 minutes away and has great connections to all major JR and subway lines. Shibuya crossing is about a 10 minute walk from the property. Make sure you have a map of the hotel, as finding it the first time around was a bit tricky with all the luggage we carried, but Shibuya station has a great information counter that can help you out with the exact location.
user_name:
CRayees
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: A free upgrade to Bears Hotel when we mentioned that we are not really into a smoking room but not choice during the time of booking. Free breakfast which was also out of our expectation. Great experience overall.

We stayed at the Shibuya Granbell for 6 nights in May 2015 and would happily book again.POSITIVES:- Perfect locationLocation is the best thing about the Shibuya Granbell. The hotel is located in the heart of Shibuya. It's a 2 min walk to Shibuya crossing and Shibuya station (Subway, JR and Narita Express lines).- Spacious and comfortable roomWe stayed in the 'Business Suite' which was incredibly spacious (see photo). The best thing about it was the lounge area which included a large sofa and plasma screen. Beds were large and very comfy.- Clean roomThere seems to be quite a few negative reviews re: cleanliness. Worth noting that our room was extremely clean and serviced daily to a very high standard.- Incredible bathroomOur bathroom was incredible. It featured both a wet room and a very large tub.- Quiet / Great sleep qualityThe hotel is located on a quiet street in the heart of Shibuya. Our room was on the 12th floor and we weren't disturbed once over 6 nights. - Great staffEmployees were very helpful and happy to help. They allowed us to check in 2hrs early on day 1 which was great. They were extremely willing to help with directions throughout our whole stay.- Affordable designTokyo is an expensive place. Most hotels we looked at were either too corporate or too expensive. The Shibuya Granbell is a great option for those looking for a 'design / boutique feel' at a reasonable price.TO BE PICKY:- Patchy WIFICould be because we were on the 12th floor of a boutique hotel, but our internet was fairly slow and kept dropping out.- Reception could use a makeoverThe reception room looked a little tired and could use a makeover. Bit of a shame as it's the first thing you see when you walk in.- Limited breakfast options.Breakfast options are limited. However, if you're in Tokyo you shouldn't eat breakfast in a hotel. Go out there and explore.

I will always come back to this place. Whether you got so enamoured with shopping or wanted to dine in the finest michelin star or drown in too much booze - getting a hotel in Shibuya is the best option especially if you are staying for a quick getaway. Always stayed here when I visit Tokyo.

My partner & I stayed at Granbell recently for 7 nights, and had a plesant stay. We arrived from Narita airport on the limousine bus (which took us to Cerulean hotel). Granbell was a short walk from Cerulean... A little hard to find, but we found our way eventually. The hotel has lots of info on Tokyo at reception, which was great for us being or first trip to Japan. The room was good... not huge but big enough for the 2 of us & our suitcases (it was worth upgrading to a Comfort Double). Bed was a little firm (not uncommon in Japan), but not terrible. The pillows were actually really comfy. I liked that they provided free bottles of water every day. Complimentary breakfast at the restaurant on 2F was Ok... Japanese, Western or French Toast options. The hotel is in a quiet spot, yet still really close to the main hustle & bustle of Shibuya & the JR station. It was a great hub for us to explore Tokyo!! Overall, a really great stay & I would definitely recommend to family & friends.

Very nice hotel , small but , the location is the best. close to Shibuya station. Many restaurants near the hotel. Millions of stores, close to Hachicko statue. Shibuya crossing. Easy to go to Tokyo and others cities . The staff at the hotel are very helpful. Rooms kind of small, but was no problem! The beds and pillows very good,the shower very good. Breakfast delicious and was free,choice of western or Japanese. I recommend to people that are in budget . Narita and Haneda airport have a Bus terminal at the Cerulean hotel, just 5 minutes from Grandbell hotel.
user_name:
Sheila N
Orlando, Florida, United States

review_body: When looking for a hotel for a Tokyo holiday I originally looked at the Cerulean Tower Hotel, which is about 2 minutes from the Granbell on foot; that hotel cost roughly double the price so I ended up choosing the Granbell instead. I don't regret it for an instant. Granbell Shibuya is 5 minutes from Shibuya JR Station/Metro/bus terminal and the infamous Scramble Crossing, which is an area packed with restaurants, shops, arcades, karaoke bars etc etc - most notably Shibuya Mark City. You can even walk to Harajuku in about 20 minutes if you're so inclined (or it's one stop on the JR line). In spite of this though the hotel is very peaceful and quiet, located on a slightly quieter side road that's mainly used by office workers.The room needs to be paid for in full when you check in. The hotel staff are very helpful and friendly (particularly when I had to call my bank in UK - they let me use their phone at no extra charge) and speak enough English to be able to deal with any questions. There are also leaflets and guides in the lobby area, and a board with instructions on how to get to Tokyo's two major airports. All of the staff are very polite and pleasant.We stayed in a Premier Double room. Although not huge, there was plenty of workable room for 2 people and the bed was huge and extremely comfortable. The bathroom was very modern, with a washbasin area a separate toilet stall and a shower/bath wetroom. The bathroom area is raised on a single step, and can be separated from the rest of the room with a curtain. The bathing wetroom has both a handshower and an amazing, powerful rainfall shower - I loved showering in this hotel! There's also a sofa, tv, safe and a fridge. Room supplies - including shampoo, shaving implements, toothbrushes and paste, shower caps, night shirts and bottled water - are replaced every day. There were a couple of small hairline cracks in the tiles of the bathroom floor, but this was the only negative point that I can think of.You can access all of the Tokyo area easily via subway and overground trains from Shibuya, which is a major and popular station. There is also a FamilyMart on the corner of the road and a 7 Eleven just around the corner (both about 1 minute's walk from the hotel). This is worth noting as many Japanese ATMs will not accept overseas cards - however, the ones in 7 Eleven will always accept foreign cards, so if you need cash (or a late-night snack) you can just pop around the corner. There is also a vending machine on the 8th floor of the hotel.The hotel is very competitively priced for its location and has free WiFi and breakfast (which is fantastic by the way - you get the choice of eating at one of 2 places on site, and I highly recommend La Dining which is significantly better than Cona). Breakfast is between 7am-10.30am at La Dining (Western and Japanese style breakfasts) on the 2nd floor, or 7am-11am at Cona (Continental breakfast) on the ground floor. The tradeoff is that the rooms do not have a view at all; our window looked out onto a wall. To be honest, you won't be spending any time in the hotel; the nightlife in Shibuya lasts all night, so I wouldn't worry about this!All in all, I was extremely happy with this hotel and am planning to visit again. I genuinely do not believe that you will find a better value hotel so close to the centre of the Shibuya area. Very highly recommended.Tips for foreign travellers -1) You can get to the hotel easily from Haneda airport using the Airport Limousine bus (1030 Y one way). Just buy a ticket at the bus counter inside the airport and go down to the stop (they will tell you where to go and speak perfect English). Take the bus to the Cerulean Tower Hotel stop, which is the first stop once you leave the airport area (about 30 minutes). The bus stops in the underground drop off point at Cerulean Tower; walk back out of the underground area, take a right and follow the path as it curves to the right; take the 3rd road on the right, and go up the hill. You will see the huge wooden door of Granbell Shibuya on the left. It can be hard to find first time. You can also catch the bus from the same place to get back to the airport (no reservation needed, just pay the driver). NOTE - the airport limousine bus does not pick up for Haneda in the afternoons on public holidays, so bear this in mind (you can also take the train, but would need to change at Shinagawa).2) Get a Suica/Pasmo card from the ticket office at the JR station as soon as you arrive if you're planning to travel around Tokyo. This costs a 500Y deposit, and can be topped up in 1000Y increments. You can use the card to pay for all subway/overground trains (except Shinkansen/Bullet Train), buses and even vending machines and some shops - keep it topped up using the machines in the station (they all have English language options) and you will save yourself the pain of buying tickets for each journey. Just scan it when you enter or leave any stations. It will tell you the remaining balance after each trip. Most one-way trips cost around 100-200Y in the Tokyo area, except for Odaiba which is more expensive.3) To get to the main Shibuya shopping/eating area, cross the main road using the footpath, walk past the bus terminal and keep going straight. You will reach the scramble crossing (can't miss it!) after about 5 minutes from the hotel door. The Hachiko statue is on the right in the little sitting spot with all of the trees.4) Walk on the left in busy stations (this rule changes in some areas, check and see what everyone else is doing), and adhere to the queues and instructions! Avoid rush hour 7am - 9.30am and 5pm - 7pm - you will be crushed into a carriage. Note that some trains have women-only carriages during rush hour, so check signs before entering the train. Do not take small children or luggage on the train during rush hour - it's not worth the stress and you will not be able to move with them.5) To get to 7 Eleven for the international cash point - go left out of the hotel (up the hill), take the first right and you will find it on the corner with the next road. Most shops take major cards like Visa, but most restaurants are cash only.6) You will be doing a LOT of walking in Tokyo, and it's very rare to find a bench or other opportunity to sit down while walking the city. You will also probably be doing a lot of standing in buses and trains as they are almost always busy in the city centre. Wear the most comfortable shoes you can find.

Great hotel, adjacent to the Shibuya Station, inside Shibuya Mark City. Loved that it offers a great view of the infamous Shibuya crossing. Any other station in Tokyo is reachable here at Shibuya Excel Hotel Tokyu. Rooms are clean and nice.

After a tiring 5 day snow trip in Hakuba, my friends and I decided to visit Tokyo for the remaining 3 days of our trip. The hotel is located in the heart of Shibuya, only minutes away from the train station and only a 5 minute walk away to Shibuya's famous street crossing. Nearly there are plenty of things to do from shopping, dining as well as nightlife. The total cost for a room was not that expensive. The room is massive but it is perfect for those travelling alone or couples. The beds were really comfortable. The staff were really friendly too. I would definitely look to stay here again on my next trip to Tokyo!

The hotel is located very near to shibuya station. Plenty of eateries near the hotel. Went there during the Sakura season. There are plenty of Sakura trees lining the street towards the hotel. Check-in swiftly and the staffs were very helpful. The only thing that I dislike it's the air con. It is way too warm for me....

The Shibuya Granbell is a small and hidden gem only a very short walk from Shibuya station. If you're interested in cool and hip nightlife, karaoke, excellent shopping and secret bars, Shibuya is the best place to stay in Tokyo - convenient to walk and use public transport. The single rooms are quite small, but super comfortable and perfect for people traveling solo. I loved that the surrounding area is compatible with a 24h/jetlagged lifestyle - never turned into a ghosttown. And the included Japanese breakfast is fantastic and a steal. Sadly, there are no views, but just have a drink at the New York bar or visit Tokyo Tower to satisfy that need.

A short walk from the Hachiko monument, and just 5 mins from the Shibuya station, you'll be hard pressed to find such a well designed option so close to all the action.Rooms are compact, but amazingly fit everything you need. It just an amazing example of Japanese efficiency. And the design is youthful and minimalist. I had so much more fun here than when I stayed at the Park Hyatt and Hyatt Regency which both cost multiples of this place. Don't let the dark photos put you off. It isn't that dark. Images of the toilet also don't tell the full story. It's very clean and though it looks Spartan, you'll be surprised how well they've packed everything you need in there.The location also makes you feel like you're close to the heart of the action, but it's far away enough for you to get a peaceful respite. You'll be u disturbed at nights despite being amidst many eateries in the neighborhood. Service was also so polite and personal, also unlike some of the major chains. And the crowd that stays here is expectedly trendy and friendly. Can't think of a better option in Shibuya.

Ideally located close to Shibuya station (max. five minutes walk).Rooms are big enough and comfortable, service was nice.A lot of restaurants to choose from in the vincinity of the hotel.Highly recommended for exploring the Shibuya area.

As already mentioned before, the location of Shibuya Granbell is so good! You're just a 5 minute walk away from the Shibuya Crossing and Station madness but when you're in the hotel, it's so very quiet. Because of the central location, it's also just a short walk to lots of great restaurants and so many other nice neighbourhoods like Daikanyama, Harajuku or Yoyogi Park. But since the west-exit of Shibuya Station is so nearby, the subway is really close as well. Tokyo subway works great, is always on time and is super easy. Just get yourself a Suica card from the machine at the station and charge it to travel. You can also use this card for the many vending machines you see everywhere in Tokyo.Hotel staff was super friendly and helpful! They all spoke English really well and helped us really good. Breakfast is free and is on two different locations. Second floor breakfast includes Japanese style, American breakfast (not that much, small omelet) or French Toast. All with excellent service and a bit restaurant style. Brace for impact for the cranky breakfast staff at the first floor (pizza restaurant) though, they obviously don't work for the hotel. Breakfast here includes croissants, toast, yoghurt, cornflakes, lychees and some potato salads that were never eaten. You can enjoy your first floor breakfast outside, so that makes up for the weird staff there and who cares anyway.WIFI is free and excellent. We slept so good here, the bed is so soft and every day free water bottles were provided. A really great hotel!

The Shibuya Granbell Hotel is just a five minute walk from the west exit of the Shibuya station. I was given a room on the 5th floor. The corridor was poorly lit (possibly to hide the worn walls which have tapes sticking on edges and corners). The room itself was nice and clean, and had enough space for two adults with two pieces of luggage to move around comfortably. Breakfast was included, but don't get too excited. The first morning we went to the western cafe on the 1st floor. It was way below average. Not only was it small, it was untidy and dirty. There were crumbs on the tables and chairs. Stale bread and croissant were on offer, plus a couple of salads. A few people walked in, had a look around and simply left. The Japanese breakfast was average, but definitely way better than the western cafe. There were plenty of eateries, shopping malls and large department stores around the hotel. So don't be put off by my comments on breakfast, the location, the service and the rooms make it a good choice.

This hotel is located within close proximity to Shibuya station. Tucked away in a little street surrounded by great little local places to eat. Easy access to train and other amenities. Very clean, neat and tidy hotel. Staff were all excellent. Would definitely recommend.

What a great location - close to the Station, only a short walk from the Hotel. The rooms although small (which is what you expect in Japan), they were clean and tidy and enough for two to move around (even with all our shopping that we did). Free breakfast included, although very limited in choices - but did the job with options between two restaurants in the Hotel. If you opted for the Japanese version it was certainly substantial in size. Staff are friendly and most welcoming. Free wifi in rooms was good also.

After searching long and hard for a hotel within Tokyo that wasn't completely bland, close to everything and had more character than blank concrete walls - we found this gem! Sure the rooms are small but that's just Japan. I actually found them quite cosy and still had plenty of room to put all my stuff.The included breakfast lacked variety if you're a fussy eater - I lived off toast, miso soup and lychees. It's odd variety for a Westerner but all 14 my friends and I survived - adds to the experience. The location is amazing! Shibuya crossing, the train station, it's got it all. Overall it was perfect for what we wanted and we would definitely stay here again. Not expensive for accommodation either - maybe we got a bulk discount!

Location is great. Less than 5 minute walk from West Exit of Shibuya Station. Arrived at 12.30pm so had to leave luggage in reception as room was not ready. Reception staff all spoke fairly good english. Room was nice, very trendy and very clean. Yes the room was small but for 1 person and 1 large suitcase it was fine. I had a room on the 12th floor (smoking room) which only appeared to have 4 rooms therefore didn't hear any noise from traffic or other guests. The breakfast which was included was ok. There are 3 choices, Western, Japanese, French. Bed and pillows were amazingly comfy. There is no need to take anything as Night Shirt, slippers, toiletries are provided. Heated toilet is wonderful if you're not used to this type of thing. Toilet control panel is on the wall which offers 3 variations of bum wash:) Plenty of bars and restaurants in the surrounding streets. Shibuya Crossing, Shibuya 109 less than 10 min walk. You walk back towards the train station and cut through Tokyu department store. When you exit, Hachiko is to your left and Shibuya Crossing and 109 are just ahead. I would definateley recommend a stay at this hotel when visiting Tokyo.

Shibuya Granbell is situated in the heart of Shibuya - close to the train station and the shopping area. A great walk to Roppongi and Shinjuku. You are amongst the restaurants and bars - if you can't find something to eat you are simply not looking. The noodle place next door is fantastic and the little bar next to that - down some steep stairs - is awesome. The pizza/ wine bar attached to hotel is fairly average as is the breakfast.This is a great priced hotel for Tokyo with clean rooms that I think are quite spacious as I have stayed in some tiny cupboards in Japan. Big bathroom and a separate toilet which I like. BUT the best bit......a soft bed and pillow! If you are planning on travelling out of Tokyo get ready for a rock hard bed and a wheat sack pillow. Would definitely stay again.

The rooms are very modern and clean. The location is extremely - it's less than a ten minute walk to Shibuya station and Shibuya crossing. The staff weren't very knowledgeable about local restaurants and sights so you had to do your own research.

Small room, 160x180 bed, tv table, and 80cm space for walk.. +bath room.. Good enough for not so expansive hottel.. Simple breakfast.. Japanese breakfast in 2nd floor and western in 1st floor.. Overall its average..

I had the pleasure of staying at the Shibuya Granbell Hotel on recent trip to Japan and I can't rate this hotel highly enough. It is an excellent location right near the main Shibuya Train Station and is super easy to find.The rooms are clean and quite spacious (for Japan) and we were very comfortable. The complimentary Japanese breakfast is also delicious! On our last night of our stay we received a complimentary upgrade to a Premium room which myself and my travel partner thoroughly enjoyed. The staff are also super helpful about trains and transport to major tourist attractions etc and spoke very good English. Overall, a marvellous experience!

we stayed at the Shibuya Granbell for four nights in a standard double. The room was small, but to be expected in Japan. The room was, however, very clean and cleaned daily with fresh waters provided. The only major down side to the room was terrible lighting (so dark- don't bother trying to read anything) and no control over the thermostat as it had not been changed from winter mode! We had to get keys so we could open our window. Breakfast is very average, so don't get too excited (don't go to the cafe breakfast downstairs unless you want cornflakes and a stale croissant).Best thing going for this hotel is its location- about 5 minutes walk from shibuya station and the shibuya crossing. We also stayed at the Shinjuku Granbell, and it was far newer, nicer, more professional staff and much nicer buffet breakfast.

Modern , clean hotel very close to station. Small rooms but well priced and we received water and free breakfast ! Staff are multilingual and polite . Free toiletries and wifi . Has 2 restaurants , cona the Italian one has good food and great lunch deal . Check out at 11am and they ring people if they haven't checked out ! Position and upkeep was excellent

firstly I found this hotel to be a great price. The location is perfect, very close to Shibuya station (2/3min walk) and 5 mins to the scramble crossing. There are bars, cafes, restaurants and supermarkets all within 1 min walk of the front door of the hotel. You can get anywhere is Tokyo from Shibuya station.The hotel itself is quiet - the room is comfy and a good size, hotels in Japan are only small but this one was big by Japanese standards, had a lounge as well as queen bed and then a big bathroom and a HUGE shower. The bed is really comfy, there is heating and AC in the room so it was always cosy. The TV only has Japanese channels but there is a good WIFI connection in the room and throughout the hotel which was fast.We didn't book breakfast with our room but they gave it to us anyway (not sure if this is standard) there are 2 options for breakfast - both are nothing fancy but was good to be provided breakfast. If you decide to pay for it don't expect much - there are cafes close by if you just wanna grab a coffee and a muffin for breakfast instead. the staff were great and helped us book seats at the robot restaurant as well as holding our bags for us after we checked out and didn't fly home until the evening. The room was cleaned spotless everyday also. Will definitely stay here again when I come back to Tokyo and will no doubt recommend it to my friends!
